Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights that drive real business decisions? We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the way we understand and act on data.




üîç What You‚Äôll Do:

Collect, clean, and analyze structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Develop dashboards and reports to monitor key performance metrics.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights to support strategy, operations, and product development.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to identify trends and inform decision-making.
Present findings clearly to stakeholders at all levels of the business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst at EQOM




Requirements

Over 4 years of experience
In a commercial, fast-paced organization
Solid knowledge of SQL and experience with dbt, Databricks, Power BI, and Python
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Located in the Netherlands




EQOM Group is a major force in Europe‚Äôs sexual wellness industry. As the company continues to professionalize and grow, data plays an increasingly vital role. The Data Analyst helps unlock the full potential of data, translating it into actionable insights and practical solutions to create value and support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.




About EQOM Group

In the fast-paced and competitive world of sexual wellness, EQOM Group stands out as one of Europe‚Äôs most prominent and rapidly expanding names. Its portfolio includes a range of well-known consumer brands such as EasyToys, Christine le Duc, Amorelie, Kondomeriet, and Beate Uhse. The group was formed in 2020 through the merger of EDC Retail ‚Äì a European market leader known for EasyToys ‚Äì and wholesale distributor Eropartner. Backed by private equity firm Waterland, EQOM accelerated its growth by acquiring Christine le Duc in the Netherlands, Kondomeriet and Nytelse in Norway, and Amorelie in Germany.




In subsequent years, the group further expanded its footprint across Europe. Today, EQOM serves customers in more than sixty countries. While the majority of sales take place online, several retail chains ‚Äì such as Kruidvat, Etos, and Hema in the Netherlands ‚Äì have also started to offer EQOM products.




Mission: become the market leader

At present, EQOM employs 360 people and generates approximately 160 million euros in annual revenue. The group is embarking on a new phase centered on further professionalization and operational alignment, guided by a clear ambition: to establish itself as the market leader in the sexual wellness industry.




Vacancy: Data Analyst

Recognizing the vital role data plays in the company‚Äôs success, EQOM Group is strengthening its Data Team with several data analysts who combine technical expertise, business understanding, and interpersonal skills. This team serves as a center of excellence for data professionals, driving high-quality analysis and insights. The Data Analyst contributes by developing data models, creating visualizations with PowerBI, uncovering meaningful insights, and delivering practical solutions that improve decision-making across departments including e-commerce, logistics, finance, sales, and purchasing ‚Äì serving both B2B and B2C operations.




However, real impact arises from understanding what the business truly needs. The Data Analyst should apply interpersonal skills to listen carefully, interpret insights, and challenge colleagues to explore new perspectives on how data can generate value beyond traditional dashboards.

Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst works with tools such as Databricks, Power BI, and dbt to build data pipelines, model data, and generate analytical insights. The immediate focus lies on strengthening the current setup to make it more effective and robust. At the same time, ongoing improvements in how EQOM Group supports its customers lead to new data streams and formats that will need to be integrated moving forward.




‚ÄúEQOM‚Äôs data maturity is still evolving ‚Äì making this the perfect moment to join. Every contribution is immediately visible and makes a tangible difference. For a data expert who thrives on building, connecting, and solving, this role offers the chance to help a company take huge steps forward.‚Äù ‚Äì Ronald van den Berg, CFO




The ideal candidate is a curious and motivated professional who knows how to ask the right questions, even when problems are not yet clearly defined. Seniority is measured less by years of experience, but more by a demonstrated track record of using data effectively to create value and drive business growth. Equally important is the ability to build strong relationships with colleagues and earn their trust, both in the role and in the power of data. To foster these connections, spending time on-site in Veendam ‚Äì ideally at least once every two weeks ‚Äì is an essential part of the role.




Interested?

EQOM Group is working with Top of Minds to fill this vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
About C Teleport

C Teleport is a fast-growing business travel technology company headquartered in Rotterdam, with a dynamic and international team of around 90 professionals globally. We deliver cutting-edge products that streamline high-volume travel management processes for businesses worldwide. Our B2B solutions leverage in-house technological expertise to help clients optimize their travel operations and deliver exceptional experiences to travelers, saving time and resources across the board.

At C Teleport, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where creativity and ideas can thrive. Join us in our mission to create exceptional products that make a difference.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Analyst who will be responsible for managing the full data flow necessary to provide actionable insights that support business objectives. You'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into strategic intelligence that drives decision-making across our organization and empowers our clients.

In this position, you'll work with two main consumer groups: internal decision-makers including product managers, product designers, and department heads, as well as external customers who rely on insights to support their decision-making based on historical and forecasted performance.

Location requirement: For optimal collaboration and real-time communication with our core team, we‚Äôre only considering candidates currently based within approximately ¬±3 hours of the Rotterdam time zone.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure & Pipeline Management


Build and maintain robust data pipelines, connecting all relevant data sources from sales, marketing, product, and finance
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting solutions
Continuously improve and optimize reporting processes and tools



Analysis & Insights


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and business objectives
Analyze data sources and identify key metrics and performance indicators
Conduct comprehensive data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic decision-making
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for various audiences



Reporting & Visualization


Design and develop comprehensive reporting solutions, including interactive dashboards, visualizations, and detailed reports
Create compelling data stories that effectively communicate findings to stakeholders
Provide training and support to users on how to utilize reporting tools and interpret data



Continuous Learning


Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data analysis and reporting
Identify opportunities to enhance our data capabilities and recommend new tools or methodologies



What We're Looking For

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with a focus on reporting and data analysis
Strong understanding of data analysis and reporting methodologies



Technical Skills


Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python)
Expert-level skills in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, QuickSight)
Proficiency in maintaining data pipelines using tools such as Airflow
Experience with AWS data-related tools is a plus
Experience with product metrics tooling like Amplitude is a plus



Soft Skills


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a cross-functional team
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality



Bonus Points


Experience with business travel platforms
Knowledge of the travel technology industry



What We Offer

Join our international team remotely and be part of a company that's revolutionizing business travel technology. You'll work in a collaborative environment where your insights will directly impact business strategy and client success.

Ready to turn data into actionable intelligence that drives business growth? We'd love to hear from you.

C Teleport is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all team members can thrive.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Business Intelligence, Regional Operations
Description:
About The Team

Shopee‚Äôs Regional Operations constantly solving problems and introducing innovative solutions to improve platform usability and enhance end user experience for our buyers, sellers, and partners.

Our teams sit at the core of our business and collaborate with various departments to manage end-to-end e-commerce processes, and design scalable solutions to create impact across multiple markets. To do so, we deep dive into the fundamentals of each aspect and drive strategic initiatives to sharpen our policy, processes and features for greater product and operational excellence.

Job Description

Our Business Intelligence Data Analysts go beyond performance monitoring and report - they play a crucial role in conducting in-depth data-powered analysis and research that drive key business decisions across Regional Operations.

We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on, motivated individual who enjoys complex problem-solving and deriving data-backed solutions to help drive high-impact business changes.


Work closely with large datasets to build data visualisation and dashboards that inform strategic planning and sound business decisions
Understand functional and technical requirements to build reports that deliver actionable insights to key stakeholders
Build and maintain data infrastructure (data pipelines, aggregated data sets, reports, dashboards) to facilitate development of key metrics to measure efficiency/impact/outcomes of day-to-day operations
Conduct research and synthesise findings into plans, processes, and playbooks that are clear and lead to actionable insights
Work closely with internal stakeholders from cross-functional and product teams across multiple markets to build, test, and implement new processes and systems
Drive adoption of the team‚Äôs initiatives through strong collaboration and alignment of organisational needs with various stakeholders


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science with 0-3 years experience
Proficiency in SQL/Python
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Hive SQL, Spark), ETL tools, data visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker) and statistical analysis (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression, data modeling techniques) preferred
Ability to analyse and synthesise data from both quantitative and qualitative sources
Ability to draw insights from data to to design practical and scalable solutions
Ability to explain technical concepts in a clear and succinct manner to various stakeholders
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment

Title: Data Analyst - Marketplace Product

Title: Data Analyst - Search & Recommendation & Ads & Content
Description:
About The Team

Shopee Search & Recommendation & Ads & Content team provides AI-based online services to our users. Behind the scenes, these services are powered by petabytes of data, numerous state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms, sophisticated and scalable service architectures, and creative business strategies. We create intelligence from massive seemingly nebulous data and turn innovative ideas into tangible products. We keep on breaking our systems‚Äô limits to keep pace with Shopee's fast-growing business. We aim to deliver a ‚Äúsmart‚Äù shopping experience on users‚Äô next click.

Job Description


Design Indicators System: Define key metrics and build automated dashboards and analytical frameworks
Analyze Data Fluctuations: Monitor key metrics and conduct deep-dive analysis on specific issues to identify underlying drivers
Make Data-driven Decisions: Data-driven decision-making by identifying, structuring, and executing product and performance analyses
A/B Test Evaluation: Design A/B experiment evaluation strategy and indicator matrix to evaluate the effect of the experiments
Data Management: Provide recommendations for e-commerce, advertisement, content(video,live stream, etc) for data improvement, quality(accuracy), and efficiency of data
Analyze business and algorithm influence and give insights to the PM team & Algo team on how to improve features, models, etc.


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields
2+ years of work experience in data analysis/business analysis
A solid grasp of common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing evaluation, time series analysis), familiarity with common data analysis methodologies
Experience using data access tools, building dashboards and analyses with large datasets and multiple data sources
Familiarity with web analytics tools and data visualisation (e.g. Google Data Studio/Lumos/Druid)
Experience working with very large data sets and distributed computing (SQL/Hive/Hadoop/MapReduce)
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, fast learner and highly organised
Good communication and teamwork skills
Experience in the e-commerce domain is preferred

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a Big Tech, is looking for a Data Operations Specialist passionate about improving operational efficiency and supporting a growing team. The ideal candidate has experience working with medium-large teams, is data-driven, understands support workflows and KPIs, and is resourceful in solving ambiguous problems.




Responsibilities:

Review operational issues, identify process gaps or tech solutions, and drive process improvements.
Track and analyze team performance metrics; identify trends and areas for improvement.
Manage daily standups, ticket prioritization, and support handovers across regions.
Prepare content for business reviews and regional meetings.
Ensure adherence to processes and flag deviations impacting support quality.
Update status pages for product issues and coordinate customer API notifications.
Document learnings and share operational insights with cross-functional teams.




Requirements:

1+ years of operations support experience in a technical environment.
Strong understanding of operational metrics, KPIs, and support workflows.
Proficient in SQL, data analysis, and data visualization tools.
Detail-oriented, customer-focused, and able to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.




This is a rolling contract role starting at 6 months.

Title: Data Analyst - Honkai: Star Rail - Fresh Grad
Description:
Who Are We?

HoYoverse is committed to providing immersive virtual world experiences to players around the world. We have brought fans popular games including Genshin Impact, Honkai: Star Rail, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Zenless Zone Zero, as well as a wide range of entertainment content.

‚Äå

Community is at the heart of everything we do. We are devoted to engaging fans and fostering an enthusiastic and inclusive global community that provides access and encouragement for people to share their passion for ACG (Animation, Comics, and Games) through their own creativity and skills.

‚Äå

Pushing the boundaries of imagination, we consistently explore cutting-edge game development technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cel shading, cloud gaming, and other fields.

‚Äå

In the future, we will continue to expand our content production, technology research, and publishing duties through operations in offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.

When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy. This policy provides detailed insights into how your information is collected, used, and protected throughout the application process.

What You Will Do:


Play an important role by providing product analysis to help in decision making as well as to ensure the long-term operations of the product with your data ability.
Establish and improve data monitoring and analyzing systems.
Provide data support to product design, operational analysis, content effect evaluation, player behavior analysis and community opinions analysis through data analysis or mathematical modeling.


What We Are Looking For:


Loyal game players, basic understanding of the gaming industry, familiar with various video games.
Extensive gameplay experience with HoYoverse Games is a plus.
Proficiency in SQL and data analysis tools including Excel, SPSS, Python or SAS.
Familiar with common data mining model (for example, clustering, regression, decision tree).
Sensitive to data, possess a strong learning ability, strong logical and analytical capabilities, and project execution skills, and able to communicate with designers and developers.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and fluent oral Chinese to liaise with teams.


We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

Title: Data Analyst (Contract)
Description:
About Maybank Securities

Maybank Securities, a leading brokerage and investment bank with a reach extending across ASEAN, the UK and the US, offers a comprehensive suite of services. These include corporate finance & advisory, navigating debt and equity capital markets, derivatives trading, brokerage and research for both retail and institutional investors, and prime brokerage.




Job Description

Monitor Retail Business Performance:

Track and monitor the daily performance of all products traded by retail clients.

Reporting:

Prepare and deliver regular reports (daily, weekly, monthly) for both the team and management, providing key insights into trading activities and business performance.

Performance & Behaviour Analysis:

Analyse retail trading performance and client trading behaviour regularly. Highlight any unusual patterns, inconsistencies, or potential risks to management.

Dashboard Development:

Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI to support various Retail departments and business initiatives.

Client Insights & Campaign Analysis:

Collaborate with the Retail team to deliver comprehensive client analysis, supporting retail initiatives and marketing campaigns with data-driven insights.

Cost Optimisation Initiatives:

Identify opportunities for cost savings and operational efficiencies to help increase net profit for the Retail pillar.

Revenue Trends & Opportunity Analysis:

Track revenue trends, identify emerging opportunities, and analyse factors that directly or indirectly impact the growth of the Retail business.

Ad Hoc Analysis & Support:

Provide prompt analytical support for ad hoc requests and business needs, often within tight deadlines.

Regulatory & Compliance Support:

Work with cross-functional teams to ensure data usage and reporting comply with regulatory requirements and organisational policies.

Agility at work:

Continuously seeks opportunities to improve and streamline processes through automation, with the aim of reducing time and cost.

Championing Company Values:

Promotes the company‚Äôs vision, desired attitudes, and culture by actively embodying and advocating organisational values.




Requirements

Degree in Finance, Mathematics, Data Science or any related fields.
At least 1 year of experience in a similar data analyst role (fresh graduates with relevant internship or project experience are welcome to apply).
Proven experience in dealing with big data processing
Solid foundation in statistical knowledge
Skillset:
Expert in Microsoft Office especially Excel and PowerPoint
Power BI or any dashboard tools
Proficient in SQL
Python is preferred
Understand data architecture
Hands on experience with ETL and processing data on backend
Understand data security, privacy and compliance




Competencies

Ability to multitask and manage multiple ongoing projects simultaneously
Willingness to challenge the status quo and suggest improvements
Team player with strong communication skills
Meticulous, with great attention to detail
A self-starter with a proactive and resourceful attitude
Proactively offers help to colleagues who require data expertise.
Ability to maintain a positive and constructive attitude when faced with challenges.
Demonstrates willingness to commit to irregular working hours when necessary.




*Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a test on statistical ability and coding proficiency.




We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Agility at work:

  • Continuously seeks opportunities to improve and streamline processes through automation, with the aim of reducing time and cost.

Championing Company Values:

  • Promotes the company‚Äôs vision, desired attitudes, and culture by actively embodying and advocating organisational values.


Requirements

  1. Degree in Finance, Mathematics, Data Science or any related fields.
  2. At least 1 year of experience in a similar data analyst role (fresh graduates with relevant internship or project experience are welcome to apply).
  3. Proven experience in dealing with big data processing
  4. Solid foundation in statistical knowledge
  5. Skillset:
  • Expert in Microsoft Office especially Excel and PowerPoint
  • Power BI or any dashboard tools
  • Proficient in SQL
  • Python is preferred
  1. Understand data architecture
  2. Hands on experience with ETL and processing data on backend
  3. Understand data security, privacy and compliance


Competencies

  • Ability to multitask and manage multiple ongoing projects simultaneously
  • Willingness to challenge the status quo and suggest improvements
  • Team player with strong communication skills
  • Meticulous, with great attention to detail
  • A self-starter with a proactive and resourceful attitude
  • Proactively offers help to colleagues who require data expertise.
  • Ability to maintain a positive and constructive attitude when faced with challenges.
  • Demonstrates willingness to commit to irregular working hours when necessary.


*Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a test on statistical ability and coding proficiency.


We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Title: Business Intelligence Solution Analyst - SG Business Intelligence
Description:
The SG Business Intelligence Solutions team is a nimble and technical group that supports the business with complex data needs. We partner closely with teams across functions to build scalable solutions, automate workflows, and deliver actionable insights using tools like SQL, Python, and Google Sheets. As a collaborative and agile team, we focus on solving real problems with practical, impactful solutions that drive smarter decision-making across the organisation.




Job Description:

Partner with business teams to provide insights to support data-driven decision-making strategy
Take part in cross-functional teams‚Äô technical data projects
Provide solid technical support on automation and business projects
Develop and maintain data workflows to support business operations and give improvement suggestions
Translate complex business requests to executional technical tasks
Automate manual reporting process by VBA/python/SQL
Monitor and optimise reporting flow from back-end to front-end
Design and develop a data mining tool to support business decision making

Title: Data Analyst - Buyer & Marketing (2025 Fresh Graduates)
Description:
About The Team

The Data Analyst Team under the Buyer & Marketing Product Line is dedicated to leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and optimize product performance. The team focuses on analyzing product effectiveness and metrics to provide actionable insights. They collaborate closely with product managers and engineering teams to ensure data-driven strategies enhance user experience and business outcomes.

Job Description


Build an e-commerce product metric system, monitor data anomalies, and promptly identify product business risks
Provide professional data support for corresponding business product decisions in e-commerce scenarios
Explore and analyze data to uncover business opportunities or product improvement directions, and produce well-organized, rigorously argued analysis reports
Actively promote various relevant departments to improve data collection and ensure the implementation of analysis recommendations


Requirements


Bachelor's degree or above in Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science and Mathematics, Engineering or a related science/tech field, expected to graduate in 2025
A solid grasp of common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing evaluation, time series analysis), familiarity with common data analysis methodologies
Experience using data access tools, building dashboards and analyses with large datasets and multiple data sources
Familiarity with web analytics tools and data visualisation (e.g. Google Data Studio/Lumos/Druid)

Title: Data Analyst - BytePlus Recommend
Description:
Responsibilities
About the team
BytePlus is a business unit in ByteDance and provides intelligent platform services powered by industry-leading research in emerging technologies. From data analytics tools to computer vision software, BytePlus solutions enable businesses to reach their potential. To help businesses access BytePlus technologies, the Platform team delivers a reliable and easy-to-use platform that businesses can use to discover, learn more about, purchase, and use BytePlus solutions. Our platform makes it radically safe and effortless for technology professionals to consume solutions like BytePlus Recommendation, BytePlus Effects, and BytePlus Data Intelligence to grow their businesses.

As a Data Analyst for BytePlus Recommend, you will work closely with Algorithm Engineer, Product Management, and Engineering teams to deliver actionable insights and data-driven decisions for our business. Your role will be pivotal in shaping our recommendation product by identifying risks and optimizing performance.

Responsibilities
- Conduct tailored data analyses to understand the specific needs and KPIs of our B2B clients.
- Propose innovative solutions by exploratory data analysis from complex and high-dimensional datasets, applying statistical and modeling techniques to improve recommendation accuracy and effectiveness, as well as client ROI
- Design, execute, and evaluate A/B tests focused on assessing the effectiveness of strategies or refinements in our recommendation algorithms. Troubleshoot any irregularities in key metrics and provide data-backed optimization strategies.
- Develop and maintain specialized dashboards that monitor key performance indicators specific to recommendation services. Translate complex data into actionable insights and communicate these clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- Work in alignment with cross-disciplinary teams, such as engineering and product, to ensure that data strategies support broader business goals, including client acquisition and retention.
- Establish standardized protocols for all manually generated project outputs. Streamline document formats, key stages, and external reporting to enhance efficiency and consistency across teams.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field such as Statistics, Mathematics, or Business Analytics with 3+ year of experience in data analytics or a similar field.
- Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL and Python, and familiar with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
- Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple projects in a fast-paced setting with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
- Strong analytical thinking, centered around problem-solving and data-driven decision-making.
- Exceptional communication skills, being able to articulate finding in a systematic way with an emphasis on simplifying complex data for stakeholders across businesses and levels.

Preferred Qualifications
- Experience with machine learning technologies is a plus.

About Us
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Lemon8, CapCut and Pico as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.‚Äã


Why Join ByteDance
Inspiring creativity is at the core of ByteDance's mission. Our innovative products are built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
As ByteDancers, we strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our Company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

‚Äé

‚Äé

Job Description


Work closely with different departments in standardizing metrics definition, identifying data sources, and building data pipelines
Build and manage all Finance-related dashboards on a regular basis ensuring data consistency and accuracy
Proactively work with different stakeholders in the finance team to anticipate and manage changes to the dashboards taking into consideration evolving business needs
Provide end-to-end data solutions to enable various teams across the company to save time on data preparation and reconciliation and routine and ad-hoc reporting
Work with a large amount of data that are at times unstructured; be a key lead in data filtering, preparation, and validation
Identify business trends and connect to the financial metrics to provide insights to the key stakeholders and influence the business direction(including but not limited to, financial profitability, sales analysis, net working capital analysis and expense analysis etc.)
Simplify complex business data and ratios into understandable and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels.
Present the insight and findings to the C-level and business heads
Automate reports and analysis to improve efficiency and reduce errors due to human intervention


‚Äé

Requirements


Masters degree in Finance, Data Analytics, Statistics, Economics or a related field
4-6 years of experience in business intelligence, financial analysis, or a similar role within a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Proficient in data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Quick Sight, Advanced Excel, Google Sheets
Strong in SQL, and Python/R language.
Have exposure and experience in GenAI implementation.
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Agile and able to adapt quickly to changing business needs and priorities
Self-Motivated and entrepreneurial by nature


‚Äé

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities:

1. Handle data processing tasks for IoT devices and mobile apps with a focus on business-oriented analysis.

2. Fulfill product managers' requirements for data extraction, analysis, and reporting.

3. Collaborate closely with product, operations, and R&D teams to drive implementation and improve business performance.

4. Independently complete specialized analyses, covering the full cycle from data processing and metric design to solution evaluation.

5. Participate in designing big data architectures and data warehouses to build an efficient big data analysis platform.




Requirements:

1. Bachelor‚Äôs degree or above, with related experience in data analysis.

2. Proficient in SQL and familiar with MySQL or other databases, with strong query processing and performance optimization skills.

3. Skilled in at least one programming language, such as Java, Scala, or Python, and familiar with common statistical and data analysis algorithms.

4. Experienced with big data ecosystem tools like Spark, Elasticsearch, and Hive.

5. Hands-on experience with at least one BI tool.

6. Strong sensitivity to data, with excellent logical reasoning and creative problem-solving skills.

7. Proficiency in documentation, communication, and presentation skills.

8. Proactive, detail-oriented, responsible, curious, and eager to learn.




Additional Information

- Salary Range: SGD 5,000‚Äì9,000 per month (based on interview), with a performance-based bonus.

Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
As ByteDancers, we strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our Company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Within Game Operations, we are committed to bringing the best digital entertainment platform to our users. Like us, you strive to understand our diverse range of users by challenging the status quo and developing innovative solutions to engage users.

As a Data Analyst, you serve as a bridge between our data and business goals, providing deep insights for making business decisions. You constantly look for innovative ways to optimize the way games are operated.

Job Description


Deliver data requests in a timely manner, including but not limited to data extraction, data analysis, data solutions and data visualization
Provide advice on best practices for data extraction methods, ensuring reliability and accuracy
Conduct in-depth data analysis and studies into problems raised by business teams
Drive the problem-solving process by suggesting hypotheses and corresponding data solutions
Collaborate with Data Scientists on machine learning models to gain deeper insights into user behaviors
Design and build data pipelines to streamline the retrieval and analysis of key information
Address and fulfill other ad-hoc data requests from Garena teams as required


Job Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field from a reputable university
At least 1 year of experience in a data-related field is preferred. Fresh graduates with strong analytical skills are welcome to apply
Strong in SQL or Python, with good knowledge of statistical modeling and basic understanding of machine learning with prior working experience
Keen interest in AI and Large Language Models (LLMs), with the ability to explore and suggest potential AI-driven solutions to enhance and optimize business processes
Strong logical thinking with the ability to present data insights clearly and effectively
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a collaborative attitude
Quick to learn and adaptable to working in a fast-paced environment
Experience and passion in the gaming industry is a plus
Passionate about games in general with at least an entry-level knowledge of the gaming industry
Show more

Title: Business Analytics Executive
Description:
Responsibilities:




Collaborate with stakeholders from Sales Planning, Operations, Finance, and Marketing to assist in generating forecast numbers.
Participate in the budgeting process by assisting in tracking Attendance, Revenue, and basic operating expenses.
Engage with stakeholders to understand workflow processes and contribute ideas for improvements.




Data Collection & Preparation

Assist in extracting, cleaning, and validating data from various internal and external sources (e.g., databases, spreadsheets, operational systems).
Support data quality initiatives to ensure accuracy and reliability of analytical inputs.




Analysis & Reporting Support:

Assist in generating regular reports and dashboards. Ensuring timely and accurate delivery to stakeholders.
Analyzing attendance trends, evaluating campaigns impact, and assessing sales performance to inform decision-making.




Customer Survey Support:

Manage the development and publication of basic surveys, ensuring data collection compliance with relevant regulations.
Collect and organize survey data, ensuring equipment readiness, and maintaining data confidentiality.







Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, Business Analysis, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields.
1-2 years of experience in business planning, analytics, or related fields preferred.
Basic understanding of budgeting and forecasting processes.
Detail-oriented with basic analytical skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas, Power Query).
Basic understanding of SQL, programing languages like Python, R.
Knowledge in Robotics Process Automation (RPA) , data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) are advantageous.
Strong communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment.
Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative team player.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About Capgemini




Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry




We are seeking a motivated Data Engineer for our NGT Program with a solid foundation in programming languages such as JavaScript, Java, Python. The ideal candidate will have technical aptitude across various aspects of software development, possess strong communication skills, and demonstrate effective problem-solving techniques while collaborating in a team environment.




Key Responsibilities:-




Develop and maintain applications using JavaScript, Java, or similar programming languages.
Assist in server-side development using Node.js and contribute to front-end development with frameworks like React.
Participate in web service development, leveraging tools such as the Spring Framework.
Understand and apply basic to intermediate networking concepts to enhance application performance.
Manage and query databases, utilizing SQL for effective database management.
Stay informed about artificial intelligence (AI) and generative AI (GenAI) concepts, assisting in the development and implementation of AI solutions where applicable.
Set up and configure servers and gain familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Collaborate with team members to solve problems effectively and enhance project outcomes through strong communication.




Qualifications:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).




Technical Skills:-




Solid foundation in programming languages (JavaScript, Java, etc.).
Basic understanding of server-side development (Node.js) and front-end frameworks (React).
Familiarity with web service development (Spring Framework).
Proficiency in SQL for database querying and management.
Introduction to AI/GenAI concepts and applications.
Basic server setup and configuration skills, with an understanding of cloud platforms.




Why Capgemini is unique




At Capgemini we don‚Äôt just believe in Diversity & Inclusion, we actively go out to making it a working reality. Driven by our core values and Active Inclusion Campaign, we build environments where you can bring you whole self to work.

We aim to build an environment where employees can enjoy a positive work-life balance. Through our New Normal campaign, we are looking to embed hybrid working in all that we do and make flexible working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people.




Get the future you want




Growing clients‚Äô businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. But when you join Capgemini, you join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs, and industry experts. A powerful source of energy that drives us all to find new ways technology can help us reimagine what‚Äôs possible. It‚Äôs why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world‚Äôs leading businesses. And it‚Äôs how you‚Äôll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge, and always pushing yourself to do better, you‚Äôll build the skills you want. And you‚Äôll use them to help our clients leverage technology to grow their business and give innovation that human touch the world needs. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is Capgemini.

Title: TikTok Shop - Data Analyst Intern - 2025 Start
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The commerce data science team aims to maximize the efficiency of commerce transactions through quantitative techniques such as mathematical statistics and machine learning. At the same time, we are committed to building a more diverse, inclusive, candid and efficient working atmosphere. We sincerely invite excellent data scientists to join us in building a first-class commerce platform.

As a project intern, you will have the opportunity to engage in impactful short-term projects that provide you with a glimpse of professional real-world experience. You will gain practical skills through on-the-job learning in a fast-paced work environment and develop a deeper understanding of your career interests.

Responsibilities:


Responsible for daily statistical analysis of business data, coordinating resources for tracking and in-depth analysis of abnormal situations;
Assist analysts in Data Insight and Qualitative and Quantitative Analysis to quickly locate internal problems or find opportunities;
Assist analysts in the construction and improvement of Data Analysis system, and explore business opportunities in terms of traffic, products and strategies.


Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Successful candidates must be able to commit to at least 4 months long internship period.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Actively enrolled university student
Bachelor degree or above, computer, statistics, mathematics and other related majors are preferred;
Skilled in SQL, EXCEL, Python and at least one scripting language, familiar with common data statistics and analysis methods;


Preferred Qualifications:


Good communication skills, teamwork spirit and initiative;
Good logical thinking ability, business interpretation ability and fast learning ability;
Sensitive to numbers and love Data Analysis work.


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

‚Äé

‚Äé

Job Description

Traveloka is one of the largest Online Travel Agencies (OTA) in Southeast Asia. Offering financial products to support purchasing power and protecting our users provides the opportunity for tremendous innovation, and requires balancing risk that does not exist in other domains. With our expanding product and market footprint, we have several openings in our Insurance product domain.

As a Data Analyst (DA) for the Insurance product at Traveloka, you will work in a diverse team of Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers as critical partners to the business. Our focus is on growing a sustainable ecosystem by providing our customers with various protection offerings suitable to their needs.

We need you to be a do-er, and when you find interesting questions, you never let them sit for long without answers. You examine the available data from the lens of proactively thinking about the needs of our customers and the business, anticipating customer needs and market trends. DAs are critical roles within our business and you know that you can make the greatest impact by gaining in-depth and comprehensive business domain knowledge, and judiciously applying your analytical talents to the domain.

In turn, we‚Äôll provide you with a mature analytics environment to work in. Reproducibility and full version control is a default in our systems so that you can easily learn from your teammates and build on foundations that have already been developed. Our collaborative team will ensure that you‚Äôre more productive than you‚Äôve ever been in a few short months.

Our techstack: BigQuery, dbt, Python, Github, Airflow, Google Cloud Build

Main Responsibilities


Understand the insurance products, our customers, the market environment and the interplay between each of these. Be able to analyze how changes in any of these will affect various metrics, and come up with new metrics to guide the business.
Develop dashboards not just for monitoring, but to produce actionable insights that decision makers can use to steer the business.
Work with the business to answer tactical questions, often via our experiments platform, that will affect the development of product features.
Work with the business to answer strategic questions that will affect the long-term goals of the business.
Develop ETL pipelines within a robust framework that is highly automated and does not require a large team to maintain and monitor.
Understand when speed is more important than accuracy in arriving at an analytical result for the business to make a decision.
Enable our key stakeholders to improve their understanding and analytical power.


‚Äé

Requirements


Minimum 2 years of analytics experience in an industry setting
You have to be curious and hungry to learn, as well as excited to share knowledge with other team members
Experience with large and sometimes messy data
Comfortable working with open-ended questions and potentially ambiguous problem statements
Experience in collaborating with people outside your domain to deliver impact
At least a Bachelor degree in a quantitative subject, e.g. finance, financial mathematics, computer science, mathematics, physics, bio-informatics, engineering
Strong in data manipulation and inferential statistics with Python and SQL
Existing business domain knowledge in any financial service product (lending/insurance/payment/etc.) is preferred but not required


‚Äé

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!
Show more

Title: Data Analytics - BI Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

As Singapore‚Äôs longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.

Today, we‚Äôre on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation. But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia‚Äôs leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.

We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career.

Your Opportunity Starts Here.

Data Analytics - BI Analyst

Why Join

As a Data Analytics BI Analyst at OCBC, you'll be at the forefront of driving business growth through data-driven insights. You'll work closely with stakeholders to identify opportunities, develop solutions, and implement changes that make a real impact. If you're passionate about data and want to make a difference, this role is for you.

How you succeed

To succeed in this role, you'll need to be a collaborative problem-solver who can distill complex data into actionable insights. You'll work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, develop targeted solutions, and implement changes that drive business outcomes. By leveraging your analytical skills and business acumen, you'll help OCBC stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly changing market.

What you do


Provide data analytics support to business stakeholders, including data analysis, reporting, and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for process improvements and implement changes
Gather requirements from the business for the development and maintenance of dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations to support business decision-making
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategy
Development and ongoing management of reporting, analysis and derivation of key customer metrics
Work with our Data Engineering team to define the key date pipelines


Who you are


At least 5 years of experience in a similar role
Understanding of banking, insurance or financial services preferred
Has prior experience of BI reporting tools (Power BI / QlikView)
Ability to analyze, identify, visualize and describe key trends within large datasets
Prior experience of leading analytical software tools and leading database environments
Curious & a real passion for understanding ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù
Creativity to see possibilities within the data & translate into compelling stories, decisions and actions for non-technical business users.
Strong communication skills and ability to influence the business to take action from the data


Who We Are

As Singapore's longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.

Today, we're on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation.

But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia's leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.

We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career. Your Opportunity Starts Here.

What we offer

Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Equal opportunity. Fair employment. Selection based on ability and fit with our culture and values. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

What We Offer

Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

You'll work closely with stakeholders to identify opportunities, develop solutions, and implement changes that make a real impact. If you're passionate about data and want to make a difference, this role is for you.

How you succeed

To succeed in this role, you'll need to be a collaborative problem-solver who can distill complex data into actionable insights. You'll work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, develop targeted solutions, and implement changes that drive business outcomes. By leveraging your analytical skills and business acumen, you'll help OCBC stay ahead of the curve in a rapidly changing market.

What you do

  • Provide data analytics support to business stakeholders, including data analysis, reporting, and insights
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for process improvements and implement changes
  • Gather requirements from the business for the development and maintenance of dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations to support business decision-making
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategy
  • Development and ongoing management of reporting, analysis and derivation of key customer metrics
  • Work with our Data Engineering team to define the key date pipelines

Who you are

  • At least 5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Understanding of banking, insurance or financial services preferred
  • Has prior experience of BI reporting tools (Power BI / QlikView)
  • Ability to analyze, identify, visualize and describe key trends within large datasets
  • Prior experience of leading analytical software tools and leading database environments
  • Curious & a real passion for understanding ‚Äúwhy?‚Äù
  • Creativity to see possibilities within the data & translate into compelling stories, decisions and actions for non-technical business users.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to influence the business to take action from the data

Who We Are

As Singapore's longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.

Today, we're on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation.

But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia's leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.

We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career. Your Opportunity Starts Here.

What we offer

Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Equal opportunity. Fair employment. Selection based on ability and fit with our culture and values. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

What We Offer

Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Business Intelligence, Cross Border
Description:
About The Team

The Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team plays a critical role in conducting close-loop data-driven business iterations. As business intelligence specialists and data analysts, our scope of work is not limited to just performance monitoring and reporting, but also in proactively finding actionable insights to help drive high-impact business changes. Our end-to-end data solution reduces the gap between the business teams and technical teams, and achieves real ‚Äòintelligence‚Äô in the iteration cycle. Browse our Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team openings to see how you can make an impact with us.

Job Description


Conduct thorough analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for Shopee cross border business organisation
Collaborate with stakeholder teams to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop metrics that align with business objectives
Lead cross-functional teams' data analytics projects
Create, monitor and optimise reporting flow using BI tools from back-end to front-end
Maintain data integrity and streamline data processes
Gather business requirements to develop small to medium size tools or simulation models in helping business to achieve quick and important goals


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs/Master Degree, preferably in data analytics, engineering, statistics, mathematics or any other quantitative discipline
2-5 years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, engineering or any other related fields
Proven technical skills: SQL, Spark, Python etc.
Experience in data analysis and process automation preferred
Able to pay attention to detail and rely on data
Able to story tell and transform numbers into key insights that drives business decisions
Able to communicate in a clear and succinct manner to stakeholders
Able to identify root causes and solve challenges
Growth and Optimisation mindsets
Show more

Title: TikTok Shop - Data Analyst Intern - 2025 Start
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The commerce data science team aims to maximize the efficiency of commerce transactions through quantitative techniques such as mathematical statistics and machine learning. At the same time, we are committed to building a more diverse, inclusive, candid and efficient working atmosphere. We sincerely invite excellent data scientists to join us in building a first-class commerce platform.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us for an internship in from October 2024 onwards. Internships at TikTok aim to offer students industry exposure and hands-on experience. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

Responsibilities:


Responsible for daily statistical analysis of business data, coordinating resources for tracking and in-depth analysis of abnormal situations;
Assist analysts in Data Insight and Qualitative and Quantitative Analysis to quickly locate internal problems or find opportunities;
Assist analysts in the construction and improvement of Data Analysis system, and explore business opportunities in terms of traffic, products and strategies.


Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Successful candidates must be able to commit to at least 4 months long internship period.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Actively enrolled university student
Bachelor degree or above, computer, statistics, mathematics and other related majors are preferred;
Skilled in SQL, EXCEL, Python and at least one scripting language, familiar with common data statistics and analysis methods;


Preferred Qualifications:


Good communication skills, teamwork spirit and initiative;
Good logical thinking ability, business interpretation ability and fast learning ability;
Sensitive to numbers and love Data Analysis work.


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Joining Razer will place you on a global mission to revolutionize the way the world games. Razer is a place to do great work, offering you the opportunity to make an impact globally while working across a global team located across 5 continents. Razer is also a great place to work, providing you the unique, gamer-centric experience that will put you in an accelerated growth, both personally and professionally.

Job Responsibilities

This role involves designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards, optimizing SQL queries, managing ETL processes, and delivering actionable insights on customer behavior and campaign performance.


Design and maintain Power BI dashboards to track KPIs for various business functions.
Write and optimize SQL queries for reporting and analysis from cloud data warehouses (e.g., Redshift).
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by managing ETL processes and troubleshooting issues in reporting pipelines.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into meaningful data insights.
Support automated reporting workflows to reduce manual effort and improve efficiency.
Conduct analysis and deliver insights on customer behavior, campaign performance, and product trends.
Coordinate regular business meetings and accurately document meeting minutes



Pre-Requisites


Minimally 3 years of industry experience in business analytics, marketing analytics or a similar quantitative discipline
Recent experience of using advanced analytics and some combination of Coding skills, Analytics tools experience (e.g. R, SQL), data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Excel, Power BI, etc) or have experience performing analysis with large datasets
Familiarity with SAP Hybris, Google Analytics, Salesforce Marketing Cloud is a plus
Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills, to be able to articulate findings and analysis to a diverse audience



Are you game?
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. Data Analyst About Gain TheoryGain Theory is part of WPP, a creative transformation company that uses the power of creativity to build better futures for its people, planet, clients, and communities.Gain Theory is a global marketing effectiveness consultancy, that uses data and analytics to deliver successful business outcomes for clients. Our vision is to inspire marketing excellence by helping marketers focus on the right data, not ‚Äòbig data‚Äô, asking and answering the questions that drive business value. We pair consultancy and technology to foster a data-informed culture that helps to drive sustainable business growth.

What‚Äôs the Vision? Gain Theory‚Äôs vision is to accelerate growth for ambitious brands and our mission is to deliver this growth by empowering smarter, faster, data-informed cultures. The Role: What will I do? As an Analyst, you will be part of the Gain Theory Data Practice and will be embedded in one of Gain Theory‚Äôs client based squads.

Working with your manager, you will be working on some of the top brands in the world and be hands on with data ranging from media, client specific, Gain Theory specific, sales, and more.

You will work as part of a team to process and organize data in preparation for modeling.

You will be challenged and have the opportunity to help innovate and automate.

The Data Analyst is expected to make use of data processing techniques including SQL and ETL to handle the data. They will also utilize our internal data automation tools to ensure data pipelines, which clean and transform data, are executed effectively. This person will also run robust data QA processes.

The quality of our data is the lifeblood of our work.

Additionally, the Data Analyst will work with the Data Manager on co-ordinating with client and agency contacts around continued flow of data from relevant data sources. The role will also interact with the wider data community within Gain Theory, especially with members of the Data Centre or Excellence (DCOE) to share best practice and both provide and receive support. Our teams bring together cutting-edge data engineering, advanced analytics, unified measurement products and enterprise scalable engineering to build products that will shape the next decade of faster, smarter, data informed decision-making. We believe that consumer privacy, client confidentiality, brand growth and user experience are essential to performance. Qualifications Background (1-2 years+) in Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering Information Science, Business Intelligence or related quantitative field In depth experience with all things data including ability to work with a variety of datasets from multiple sources, familiar with standard data processing tools/concepts (e.g. SQL, NoSQL ETL), and experience driving robust QA processes Experience with the advertising ecosystem (e.g. ad trafficking, Ad servers, DSPs, Media Strategy and Activation, etc.) and a working knowledge of appropriate metrics, measurement, and reporting Required skillsets: SQL, ETL, Cloud Compute/Storage (Azure or AWS) Nice to have skillsets: Snowflake, Python, GIT Experience with DBT is valuable but not required Has project management skills including planning tasks and deliverables, managing timelines and risks, and overseeing simultaneous projects Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills English proficiency Values and Behaviors I Demonstrate Joining Gain Theory means joining a group of people who live, breath and behave by our values:

Be Curious: continuously asking, understanding, learning, and developing.

Be Positive: approaching everything we do with a positive mindset and making positive impact on each other.

Act with Consideration: seeing things from someone else‚Äôs perspective; respecting and embracing diverse thinking.

Make it Better: continuous improvement and stretching our abilities, being honest with ourselves and each other. Gain Theory is committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect. As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve.We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process. WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our LTA project team. In this role, you will focus on creating Tableau dashboards, working closely with the data team, developers, and testers. You will assist with the transition of data from Phase 1 to Phase 2, as well as with dashboard redesign and data set refinement.




Key Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢ Focus on Tableau dashboard creation and customization. ‚Ä¢ Work closely with developers, testers, and the data team to refine and implement dashboards. ‚Ä¢ Assist with data aggregation and the transition of data between project phases. ‚Ä¢ Conduct basic SQL queries for data extraction and manipulation. ‚Ä¢ Participate in the redesign of dashboards and the refinement of data sets. ‚Ä¢ Support the team in ensuring the accuracy and quality of data visualizations.




Required Skills & Experience: ‚Ä¢ 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or dashboard development. ‚Ä¢ Basic experience with Tableau for dashboard creation. ‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of SQL for basic data manipulation and query execution. ‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn and grow in a collaborative team environment. ‚Ä¢ Ability to handle tasks related to dashboard creation and basic troubleshooting. ‚Ä¢ No prior requirement for advanced server administration or complex troubleshooting

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Risk)
Description:
SHIELD is a device-first fraud intelligence platform that helps digital businesses worldwide eliminate fake accounts and stop all fraudulent activity.¬†

Powered by SHIELD AI, we identify the root of fraud with the global standard for device identification (SHIELD Device ID) and actionable fraud intelligence, empowering businesses to stay ahead of new and unknown fraud threats.

We are trusted by global unicorns like inDrive, Alibaba, Swiggy, Meesho, TrueMoney, and more. With offices in LA, London, Jakarta, Bengaluru, Beijing, and Singapore, we are rapidly achieving our mission - eliminating unfairness to enable trust for the world.

Responsibilities

¬†As a Data Analyst (Risk), you will be involved in supporting the risk operations by retrieving meaningful and relevant information from large databases, conducting data analysis to discover fraud trends and patterns. Thereafter, helping in designing long-term solutions to fight fraud. The insights you provide will contribute towards optimizing risk management strategies and creating business value by enabling trust for our clients. Responsibilities include:¬†


Handle end to end process from retrieving data, data analysis, deriving insights, summarizing, and presenting recommended actions to stakeholders in order for us to stay ahead of new and unknown fraud.¬†
Utilize statistical tools to identify areas of potential fraud risk and/or potential areas of improvements to current fraud detection mechanisms.¬†
Collect, validate, and clean data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and reliability.¬†
Optimize fraud detection by rapidly identifying emerging fraud trends through data-driven analysis in complex and large dataset such as device metadata, user data, payment data - and coming up with proposals to address them and preventing future occurrence.¬†
Improve and maintain dashboards to provide visibility of key metrics and fraud patterns for relevant stakeholders.¬†



Requirements


2 - 5 years of experience as a hands-on data analyst.¬†
Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Sciences, Statistics, Mathematics, or other related fields.¬†
Working experience in handling large-scale unstructured data.¬†
Proficiency in SQL or other data handling tools.¬†
Experience in using business intelligence tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, and Microsoft Excel.¬†
Experience with any data analysis tools such as Python, R, SPSS and SAS.¬†
Ability to take initiative in a fast-moving and dynamic environments, and take timely actions to prevent risk of fraud.¬†
Show more

We are trusted by global unicorns like inDrive, Alibaba, Swiggy, Meesho, TrueMoney, and more. With offices in LA, London, Jakarta, Bengaluru, Beijing, and Singapore, we are rapidly achieving our mission - eliminating unfairness to enable trust for the world.

Thereafter, helping in designing long-term solutions to fight fraud.
