Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Portfolio / Data Analyst

Sector: Renewables

Location: Stockholm




I am working with a leading investment fund in the renewables space looking for a Portfolio / Data Analyst to join the team in Stockholm.




Key Responsibilities

Monitored renewable energy assets (Solar, Wind, Hydro, Storage) using SCADA systems to ensure optimal performance.
Extracted and analysed performance data to produce accurate and timely technical KPIs.
Delivered actionable insights to support asset optimisation and informed decision-making.
Developed and presented reports using visualisation tools (e.g. Power BI) for wider team use.
Led process automation initiatives to improve efficiency across internal workflows.
Coordinated with external contractors and stakeholders to validate and analyse technical data.
Contributed to cross-functional project management across the broader Energy & Infrastructure team.
Supported risk and compliance analysis across diverse datasets and technologies.
Acted as a values-driven representative of the company, maintaining professional standards.




Skills & Tools

Strong communication skills for translating technical insights to non-technical audiences.
Proficient in Excel; experience with Power BI/Tableau (preferred).
Basic coding experience (Python preferred but not essential).




If you're interested, please send your CV to b.noctor@tgrc.com

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst, Retail

Do you have a keen eye for detail and a structured approach to your work? Are you looking for the opportunity to leverage your strong analytical skillset and work with data that affect business decisions? And, do you want to work alongside can-do spirited people who are striving for excellence? Then, keep on reading!

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Retail Data Analyst to join us on an interim contract until December 2025. As our new colleague, you will be collaborating with the other team members (Data Engineers, Data Scientists, etc.) and providing feedback on the data pipelines. You will be working with management to prioritize business and information needs, while also locating and defining new process improvement opportunities. You will have the ability to build a larger business narrative around data, and communicate the insights derived to a broader array of business stakeholders.

Additionally, the role responsibilities will include:


Acting as the face of the product team with business stakeholders as needed.
Creating and maintaining the logic and processes to support trustworthy and efficient consumption of business data.
Developing and implementing databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Investigating data sources across enterprise, and expanding existing search data infrastructure, identifying opportunities to expand modelling and customer obsession efforts.
Filtering and cleaning data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Identifying, developing, managing, and executing analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help grow the search business internally and for partners worldwide.
Identifying opportunities for developing new data sources and providing technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available.



In order to succeed:

You are a strong team player who likes to take ownership and has a results-driven approach. You strive for excellence and are focused on delivering results with high standards. You are comfortable giving definition to ambiguous problems, and you enjoy working independently with limited guidance. You‚Äôre able to build a story around the data and convey the findings of the analysis to several business and non-business stakeholders.

In addition, we hope that you have and can demonstrate:


1-3+ years of professional experience in data modelling and advanced business analytics, with 2+ years of SQL and experience with efficient processing of large data sets.
Bachelor‚Äôs (or relevant work experience) in a quantitative discipline like Computer science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering etc.
Proficiency in big data analytics tools (R, Python etc.) and standard analytics packages like SPSS.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent verbal and written communication & data presentation skills, including experience to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with big data technologies and large-scale, complex datasets.
Experience in designing and building data infrastructure/automated reporting tools.
Experience in advanced business/customer analytics.



Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora‚Äôs experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment ‚Äì that we are not only talking about ‚Äì but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Trainer
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location

üåç Remote (CET +/-3h) or üá©üá∞ Copenhagen




The product

Next-generation data warehouses like Snowflake, Databricks, and Google BigQuery are becoming the standard place to centralize all your data since they have become affordable and highly performant.




Built around modern data warehousing, we provide state-of-the-art data infrastructure that works in a few clicks without data engineering. In that way, Weld enables powerful analytics and workflows that can make a company truly data-driven.




‚ö° Give the product a try; sign up at weld.app




The role

At Weld, we believe data should empower, not overwhelm, teams. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be critical in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive internal decision-making and customer success. You'll work internally and directly with customers, helping them make sense of their data and unlock its full potential by using the Weld platform.




You‚Äôll support every data lifecycle stage, from designing and modeling warehouse schemas to crafting dashboards and running deep analyses. You‚Äôll also serve as a trusted partner to customers, helping them implement metrics, interpret data trends, and get value from their ETL and reverse ETL processes.




We're hoping that you;

are fluent in SQL and have experience with data modeling tools (like dbt or similar)
have a solid understanding of ETL, reverse ETL, and data warehousing best practices
are comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights
have a good understanding of statistics and experimental design
have strong communication skills and enjoy working directly with customers to understand their data needs
can clearly communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
have experience mentoring junior analysts or collaborating cross-functionally with product and engineering teams
bonus points for experience using Python or R for data wrangling, automation, or statistical analysis, and with BI platforms like Power BI, Looker, Tableau, or Metabase.




The team

As generalists, we have expertise, are always open to new challenges, and offer assistance when needed. Currently, we seek individuals who are enthusiastic about learning and fearless in taking on end-to-end projects. We are looking for curious individuals who can take on a given problem and solve it. We particularly welcome entrepreneurial minds who thrive in the early stages of a startup.




How we work

We prioritize creating a vibrant, fun, exciting, and challenging culture. Our highly talented and passionate team, who firmly believe in the power of collaboration, makes this possible.




We value ownership and offer significant freedom and responsibility while fostering close teamwork. We are remote-friendly and strive to create the best office and remote experiences. We achieve this through various means, such as organizing social events and gatherings for team camps across the globe.




How to apply

Apply via LinkedIn

Mention 2-3 of your most significant achievements and 2-3 of the most important lessons you've learned in your career.




Some nice things about working at Weld üíõ

üí∞ Competitive salary and equity

üèùÔ∏è 6 weeks paid holiday per year

üëµ Company-paid pension scheme

üõü Company-paid health insurance

üë©‚Äçüè≠ Flexible working hours

‚úàÔ∏è Every quarter, we spend 3 to 4 days together enjoying social activities, team building, and having lots and lots of fun!

üí≥ Everyone gets a company card from day one. Meaning that you can buy your own things for work whenever needed

üá©üá∞ We have a nice office space in central Copenhagen right next to the Opera

üåç We are remote-friendly, and everyone who joins has the option to work from anywhere CET +/- 3h

ü•ô Everyone who joins the Copenhagen office gets free lunch

üíª Macbook Pro

üë©‚Äçüíª All the latest and best productivity software and tools

üè° Company-paid co-working space or home office setup for those working remotely




Our values




Extreme customer focus ‚ù§Ô∏è

Since we started Weld, putting our customers first has been and will continue to be our top priority. Our ability to make our customers happy will define our long-term success.




Move fast ‚ö°Ô∏è

Action beats inaction. Do things now. Not tomorrow. Our intent is not to sacrifice quality but to be efficient by not reinventing the wheel and focusing on the things that matter.




Dream big üöÄ

We chase the most ambitious ideas to advance our mission in ways that encourage experimentation, accept failure, and regularly deliver new value for our customers.




Our Mission

Today, being data-driven requires extensive tooling and expertise, which makes it out of reach for most companies. We believe there should be a simpler alternative that enables all businesses to become truly data-driven.




Weld was founded in Copenhagen in 2021 by tech entrepreneurs Jonas Thordal, Jakob Skytte, Jakob Kristensen and Kristian Barrett. All four were early members of the startup success Pleo, where they helped build the data infrastructure from scratch.




That‚Äôs when they saw that getting value out of data was a lot easier said than done, so they decided to build a better solution.




We're backed by forward-thinking investors - Cherry Ventures and Frontline Ventures

Show more
HTML:
Location

üåç Remote (CET +/-3h) or üá©üá∞ Copenhagen


The product

Next-generation data warehouses like Snowflake, Databricks, and Google BigQuery are becoming the standard place to centralize all your data since they have become affordable and highly performant.


Built around modern data warehousing, we provide state-of-the-art data infrastructure that works in a few clicks without data engineering. In that way, Weld enables powerful analytics and workflows that can make a company truly data-driven.


‚ö° Give the product a try; sign up at weld.app


The role

At Weld, we believe data should empower, not overwhelm, teams. As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be critical in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive internal decision-making and customer success. You'll work internally and directly with customers, helping them make sense of their data and unlock its full potential by using the Weld platform.


You‚Äôll support every data lifecycle stage, from designing and modeling warehouse schemas to crafting dashboards and running deep analyses. You‚Äôll also serve as a trusted partner to customers, helping them implement metrics, interpret data trends, and get value from their ETL and reverse ETL processes.


We're hoping that you;

  • are fluent in SQL and have experience with data modeling tools (like dbt or similar)
  • have a solid understanding of ETL, reverse ETL, and data warehousing best practices
  • are comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights
  • have a good understanding of statistics and experimental design
  • have strong communication skills and enjoy working directly with customers to understand their data needs
  • can clearly communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
  • have experience mentoring junior analysts or collaborating cross-functionally with product and engineering teams
  • bonus points for experience using Python or R for data wrangling, automation, or statistical analysis, and with BI platforms like Power BI, Looker, Tableau, or Metabase.


The team

As generalists, we have expertise, are always open to new challenges, and offer assistance when needed. Currently, we seek individuals who are enthusiastic about learning and fearless in taking on end-to-end projects. We are looking for curious individuals who can take on a given problem and solve it. We particularly welcome entrepreneurial minds who thrive in the early stages of a startup.


How we work

We prioritize creating a vibrant, fun, exciting, and challenging culture. Our highly talented and passionate team, who firmly believe in the power of collaboration, makes this possible.


We value ownership and offer significant freedom and responsibility while fostering close teamwork. We are remote-friendly and strive to create the best office and remote experiences. We achieve this through various means, such as organizing social events and gatherings for team camps across the globe.


How to apply

Apply via LinkedIn

Mention 2-3 of your most significant achievements and 2-3 of the most important lessons you've learned in your career.

Title: Digital (eCommerce) Insights Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning data into meaningful insight and using it to shape eCommerce decisions? Do you love to interrogate the numbers to uncover the "why" behind the "what"? If so,

we‚Äôre looking for a Digital Insights Analyst to join our team!




In this exciting role, you‚Äôll work closely with our global Retail commercial teams, translating analytics into actionable commercial insights. You‚Äôll play a key part in shaping eCommerce strategy and supporting tactical decisions, while helping the team unlock new ways to harness the full potential of our data. This role offers cross-functional exposure, collaborating not only with the eCommerce team but also with key partners in Category Management, Promotions, Forecasting, Data Science, Digital Products, and more.




We're pleased to share that we offer a hybrid working week arrangement called Best of Both, requiring 3 days in the office location and 2 days from home.




The closing date for external applications will be 22nd June 2025.




No relocation assistance is offered for this position.




Core Responsibilities

Analyse LEGO.com performance using a mix of digital analytics and qualitative insights to uncover key drivers and tell a clear performance story.
Deliver actionable insights across the full shopper journey, from engagement to delivery, to drive meaningful optimisations.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Business Intelligence, Trading, and Operations to deepen understanding of regular performance trends.
Support major marketing events like Black Friday and Cyber Monday with real-time performance reporting and optimisation opportunities.
Create and maintain bespoke reports to help LEGO Retail teams understand LEGO.com commercial performance, and deliver training to boost data literacy.
Ensure data quality and governance by partnering with data owners and maintaining accurate, reliable reporting systems.




Do You Have What It Takes.

Strong analytical skills with a high confidence in using SQL.
Established proficiency in data visualisation, preferably Power BI.
Must have digital analytics experience with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics.
Experience of data structure and the ability to create insights from a range of both quantitative & qualitative & data
A storyteller with commercial experience, preferably from an eCommerce Insights team or similar
Excellent written and verbal communication ability in English.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.




Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Data Analyst / Statistician (Category II)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTU International A/S is leading a consortium for the preparation of proposal for the EU funded project in SEA Lot 6: Education Sector Public Expenditure Review (PER) in Greenland and is searching for non-key experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.

The overall objective of the Education PER would be to provide evidence-based recommendations for: better fiscal management, efficiently and effectively use of public expenditures to support Greenland‚Äôs education sector, improve service delivery).




Data Analyst / Statistician (Category II)




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct in-depth analysis of budget execution, fiscal policies, and financial oversight mechanisms.
Analyze large and complex datasets to identify trends in public spending and financial performance.
Conduct variance analysis and support cost-benefit and cost-effectiveness assessments.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and integrity across various sources.
Develop compelling data visualizations, dashboards, and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with finance, education, and policy experts to support integrated analytical outputs.
Contribute to the design and implementation of data collection strategies where needed.
Prepare analytical reports, briefs, and data summaries for stakeholders and decision-makers.




‚òùÔ∏è Qualifications and skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in English (C1); Knowledge of Danish or Greenlandic is an asset.

‚òùÔ∏è Professional experience:

Minimum of 7 years of relevant professional experience, with demonstrated expertise in data analysis, preferably in public finance, economics, or development sectors.
Advanced proficiency in statistical software and data visualization tools (e.g., R, Python, STATA, SPSS, Tableau, Power BI).
Proven experience in handling large datasets and applying advanced statistical techniques.
Strong knowledge of public sector data, fiscal indicators, or development finance is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in accessible formats.




‚òùÔ∏è Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with government, development agencies, or international institutions.
Familiarity with open data standards, GIS, or machine learning tools is a plus.
Publication or authorship of relevant analytical reports or dashboards.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning data into insight‚Äîand insight into action?

At Les Deux, we‚Äôre looking for a driven and curious Data Analyst to help us scale smarter, faster, and more efficiently. You‚Äôll join us at our dynamic headquarters in Copenhagen, where innovation meets ambition in an entrepreneurial fashion brand on a rapid international growth journey.

About The Role

As our new Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be collaborating with teams from Sales and Product to Finance and Supply Chain. Your mission? To transform complex data into clear insights that inform key business decisions. You'll work hands-on with sales tracking, demand planning, product performance analysis, and development of business intelligence platforms and dashboards.

At Les Deux, we believe in acting fast on data-driven insights; your work won‚Äôt sit in a report; it will directly influence what we do next.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing



Analyze sales performance across products, markets, and channels
Support demand planning with accurate data and forecasting
Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI or similar tools
Help develop and maintain our data platforms and pipelines
Communicate insights clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Drive continuous improvement in our reporting processes and data quality



What We Are Looking For



1‚Äì2 years of relevant experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field
Educational background in business, finance, data science, or similar
Strong analytical mindset‚Äîyou‚Äôre comfortable working with large datasets and uncovering patterns
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data into business insight
Experience with SQL and data warehouse management (Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and Google BigQuery are a plus)
Proficiency in Power BI or similar data visualization tools
Advanced Excel skills
Fluency in English



Not ticking every box? Don‚Äôt worry. If you‚Äôre eager to learn and bring a proactive attitude, we‚Äôd still love to hear from you.

What We Have To Offer

Our culture is one of the key elements that helped us grow from two people with a side project to an international brand with a team of 100 people. You spend a third of your life at work, so we think it‚Äôs important that you have a great time while doing it. At Les Deux, we aim to create an environment where people thrive both professionally and personally. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:



A fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with real influence on business decisions
A buzzing HQ in Copenhagen with a strong team spirit
Regular social events, Friday bars, team workouts, and meditation sessions
Flexible working hours



How To Apply

If the above sounds like you and you think you‚Äôd fit right in, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

We believe that difference makes us stronger and encourage everyone to apply regardless of age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion, or sexual orientation.

Apply with your CV and a short Cover Letter explaining why you‚Äôd be a great fit. We‚Äôll be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis.

Title: Data Analyst for Performance Management
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description:

Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus?

What The Job Is

This role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world.

You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions.

We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers.

Key deliverables:


Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
Benchmarking across the company

How You Will Contribute To The Team

Key competencies needed to succeed in this position


Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary


What does your next challenge look like?

At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers‚Äô orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options


Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

What The Job Is

This role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world.

You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions.

We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers.

Key deliverables:

  • Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
    • work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
    • Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
  • Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
    • Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
    • Benchmarking across the company
How You Will Contribute To The Team

Key competencies needed to succeed in this position

  • Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
  • Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
  • Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
  • Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
  • Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary

What does your next challenge look like?

At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan.

In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide.

Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures.

If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow.

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company!

About SATAIR

Satair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers‚Äô orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment.

With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family.

Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this.

If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany !

What do we offer at SATAIR?

At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas.

SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely!

Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:

  • Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
  • Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
  • Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
  • Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options

Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company

Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team!

We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Company:

Satair A/S

Contract Type:

Permanent

Experience Level:

Professional

Job Family:

Digital

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.

Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com .

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Ballerup 2750, Denmark, Denmark

Contract type: Permanent

Job ID: 3259

Shape the LEO Pharma of tomorrow

At LEO Pharma, our mission transcends the conventional. We're on an ambitious path to become the leaders in medical dermatology worldwide.

In Business Data & Analytics we share a ‚Äúchallenge accepted‚Äù mindset and are guided by our winning behaviours of simplification, collaboration, and accountability, to achieve our goals.

Your role

You will strengthen and simplify the way our customers work with data and enable them to make strategic decisions based on reliable, standardized data and analytics solutions. You will also partner with the business to develop Business Intelligence solutions which are used uniformly and embedded in the business processes.

Understand customers‚Äô data- and analytics needs translating them into insights solutions and robust processes.
Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders establishing a reputation as a trusted partner with subject matter knowledge within the area.
Identify, track and report on KPIs acting as a sparring partner for the line of business on what is relevant and possible.
Collaborate with Business Data & Analytics team members and participate in defining best practice within the team.
Proactively consult with stakeholders on ad-hoc analytical projects, including advising on best practice and identifying relevant use cases.
Support the line of business by providing training on tools and techniques and help with translating data into actionable insights as needed.
Stay up to date with technology development and how we can optimize our BI solutions in LEO Pharma.
Support cross-functional projects related to own area of expertise using structured project management tools.
Ensure high quality across our solutions and deliveries by reviewing others‚Äô work and asking for feedback.
Develop, maintain, and automate data workflows, datasets, reports, dashboards, and analytics solutions.
Continuously drive improvements to increase data quality, consistency, and reliability, and find new (smarter) ways to further automate and apply analytics.
Explore opportunities for predictive analytics, develop tools for the analyses, and interpret their results.
Communicate data and analyses to relevant stakeholders.


Your Qualifications

To succeed in this role, we imagine that you have the following qualifications:

A master‚Äôs degree
3 years‚Äô business analytical experience with a track-record of quantitative data analysis and data modelling
2 years‚Äô experience in data partnering/analytics within the supported area (e.g. people, supply chain or finance)
Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with Microsoft Power BI
Experience with other Microsoft Power Platform components (Power Automate and Power App)
Programming experience with M, DAX or SQL
Experience conducting statistical analyses in e.g., STATA, SPSS, SAS, R, or Python
Knowledge of SAP ECC and SAP Analysis/BW is an advantage
Solid stakeholder management skills
Good project management skills
Fluency in written and verbal English


LEO Pharma is built on collaboration, innovation and curiosity. Is this you? Can you bring this and:

Strong customer focus with excellent communication skills.
Detail-oriented and committed to delivering high-quality results.
Self-motivated with a proactive, "can-do" attitude.
Collaborative team player who values knowledge sharing.
Curious and eager to learn new skills and concepts.
Analytical mindset with a passion for data and technology.
Takes initiative and demonstrates a strong sense of responsibility.


Your application

You do not need to upload a cover letter, but feel free to add a few sentences in your resume or CV on why this position has your interest.

Beyond the skin

Join LEO Pharma, a global leader in medical dermatology, as we go beyond the skin to make a lasting impact. Our innovative approach sets us apart. We are dedicated to leaving a legacy that positively impacts patients, colleagues, and our planet.

At LEO Pharma, we believe in the power of individuals to drive change. Our flat organizational structure empowers you to make a visible impact and offers versatile roles for professional growth. We value diversity and welcome applications from all qualified candidates, recognizing that our different perspectives, backgrounds, and attitudes enable us to make the best decisions. Join our passionate team at LEO Pharma and be yourself as we work together to make a difference.

For certain positions, LEO Pharma might complete a background check conducted by a third party.

Report a concern: Whistleblower hotline | LEO Pharma

Title: Data Analyst - Product
Description:
Are you passionate about turning data into game-changing product insights? Do you thrive in an environment where your analytical skills help shape the future of digital banking?




At Lunar, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst for Product to bring clarity to complexity, empowering our teams with the insights they need to build world-class products. If you love working with data, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and making a tangible impact, keep reading!




Who we are




At Lunar, we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics.




So, who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both ‚Äî breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks.

What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




The Role




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Data Analyst for Product to drive data-driven decision-making so that we can optimize our product strategy and deliver seamless customer experiences.




As our new Data Analyst for Product, you will be part of our Product team. The team currently comprises 3 amazing individuals working across Aarhus and Copenhagen, who are focused on embedding a data-centric approach within our Product function, led by Christina Vestergaard. We prefer to hire for this position for our Aarhus hub.




What will you do?




Conduct in-depth analysis to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that shape product roadmaps and strategic decisions.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the impact of product initiatives.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics tools to ensure visibility into key product metrics.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other teams to integrate data into decision-making.
Work with Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering teams to enhance our data ecosystem, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.
Deliver compelling data storytelling through visualization and presentations to influence stakeholders.




Curious about the Lunar culture? üíö




Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It‚Äôs infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we‚Äôre all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.




We‚Äôre excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role!




We can‚Äôt wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Minimum 3 years of full-time work experience as a Data Analyst, Product Analyst, or similar.
Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics insights.
Strong strategic thinking with the ability to translate product and business objectives into analytical plans.
Advanced skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with analytics tools like Looker. Experience with dbt, GitHub, and Python is a plus.
Understanding of product development processes and experience working in agile environments.
Experience within the Product Analytics domain is preferred. The ideal candidate has worked across the full product lifecycle ‚Äî from product discovery and opportunity assessment to experiment design, performance evaluation, and reporting.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to influence cross-functional teams.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal.







Are you ready to join the journey?




Apply now and let‚Äôs find out more!




While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we‚Äôre up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it‚Äôs like to work here, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights!




Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven thinker with a passion for products and business insights?




At BIBS, we are looking for a Product Analyst to join our growing Product Management team. Initially a 1-year maternity cover position with potential to become a permanent role for the right candidate. This role is perfect for someone with up to 3 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar analytical role. If you thrive on uncovering insights from data, want to influence product decisions, and enjoy working in a dynamic team, this is the role for you!







About the Role




As Product Analyst, you will play a key role in structuring and analysing data to drive product strategy and decision-making. Your insights will support business-critical decisions on pricing, sales performance, product assortment, and lifecycle management.




This is an execution-focused role where you will work with large data sets, competitor analysis, and pricing insights, helping us make smarter, data-driven product decisions. You will collaborate closely with:




Head of Product Management (your manager) to provide insights that shape the roadmap
Product Manager to optimize assortment planning and pricing strategies
Product Data Student Assistant to ensure structured data collection for analysis
Sales, Marketing, and Finance teams to share key findings and support decision-making




This is an opportunity to shape the analytical foundation of our product management team while developing your career in a fast-paced, international company.







Key Responsibilities




Sales Performance Insights ‚Äì Identify trends, revenue drivers, and areas for SKU efficiency, helping optimise our product portfolio.




Pricing & Competitor Analysis ‚Äì Conduct pricing reviews, analyse competitor landscapes, and support price optimization initiatives.




Lifecycle & Assortment Strategy ‚Äì Provide data-driven recommendations on when to launch, refresh, or phase out products.




Data Structuring & Reporting ‚ÄìEnsuring clean, structured data for effective analysis.

Product Budget & Sales Analysis ‚Äì Create internal product budget plans aligned with sales forecasts, ensuring our product strategy supports commercial goals.




Stakeholder Communication ‚Äì Translate complex data into actionable insights for presentations to senior management, sales, and marketing teams.







What We‚Äôre Looking For




1-3 years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, or a related field.
Strong analytical mindset ‚Äì ability to work with data, identify patterns, and translate insights into actions.
Advanced Excel skills ‚Äì pivot tables, data modelling, and proficiency in working with large datasets.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI) and an interest in AI-driven analytical approaches.
First hand knowledge or interest in the baby category is a clear advantage
Self-starter ‚Äì you can structure your own work and drive projects forward with minimal oversight.
Clear communicator ‚Äì able to present data in a concise, impactful way to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in pricing analysis, competitor benchmarking, or product portfolio management.







Why Join BIBS?




Grow with the role ‚Äì We offer opportunities to develop within Product Management and gain more responsibility over time.

Make an impact ‚Äì Your insights will directly influence pricing, sales, and product strategy.

Collaborative office culture ‚Äì We believe that working together in person fosters better teamwork, innovation, and company culture.




A fun and social workplace ‚Äì Enjoy Friday bar, Candy Tuesday, and free soda, because great work deserves great perks!




How to Apply




Interested? We‚Äôd love to hear from you! You do not need to attach a separate cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.




Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early, by sending your application to sam@bibsworld.com!




Join BIBS and help us make data-driven product decisions that shape the future of our brand!

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Are you passionate about data analytics? Do you want to gain hands-on experience in analyzing and visualizing data? We are looking for an intern to join the Product Supply Aseptic Manufacturing BI&Analytics team at Novo Nordisk. If you are eager to learn and contribute to process improvement and optimization through digitalization, read on and apply today for a life-changing internship.

The position

As an intern at the Aseptic Manufacturing BI&Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to:



Gather information and analyze data from various sources and systems
Develop process automation flows to streamline operations
Support the development of team standards for our digitalization tools
Identify opportunities for improvement and optimization in our processes and solutions




We use a range of platforms including Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, PowerApps, and PowerAutomate, so you can expect to learn about this spectrum of low-code/no-code tool stack

Practicalities:



Internship position for 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to one year
Full-time working hours, with flexibility during exam periods
August/September as starting date
Internships are remunerated if your educational track allows it




Qualifications

To be successful in this internship, we are looking for someone who:



Is currently pursuing a university degree or master‚Äôs in business administration, Business Development, Business Analytics, Data science, Digital Design, Engineering or similar.
Has a passion for data analytics and process improvement
Has basic knowledge of data analysis and visualization
Has excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Is fluent in English




We are looking for an Intern who is proactive, collaborative, and structured with high quality standards and the ability to spot opportunities for optimisations. It is an advantage if you have experience with tools such as Alteryx/Tableau/Power BI/PowerApps or coding experience

Please note that a Danish full-time work permit is required for this position.

About The Department

You will be joining our HQ team, which serves as the center of excellence for Business Intelligence & Analytics for all Aseptic Manufacturing (AM). AM is a global production organization with more than 8,000 employees across 4 continents. Our department is responsible for leading strategic and cross-functional projects that involve multiple production sites.

Working at Novo Nordisk

Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company with a 100-year legacy of driving change to defeat serious chronic diseases. Building on our strong legacy within diabetes, we are growing massively and expanding our commitment, reaching millions around the world and impacting more than 40 million patient lives daily. All of this has made us one of the 20 most valuable companies in the world by market cap. Our success relies on the joint potential and collaboration of our more than 63,000 employees around the world. We recognize the importance of the unique skills and perspectives our people bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk, we‚Äôre working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it‚Äôs a collective effort. Join us! Together, we go further. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

Contact and Deadline

For further information, please contact Luisa Katsambi +45 30790278 or Yue Xu +45 34448845 or get to know us better by visiting www.novonordisk.com/careers. Apply by 30th June 2025.

Kindly note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews conducted on a rolling basis. Please refrain from adding a photo to your CV to ensure fair and efficient processing.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

HTML:
Are you passionate about data analytics? Do you want to gain hands-on experience in analyzing and visualizing data? We are looking for an intern to join the Product Supply Aseptic Manufacturing BI&Analytics team at Novo Nordisk. If you are eager to learn and contribute to process improvement and optimization through digitalization, read on and apply today for a life-changing internship.

The position

As an intern at the Aseptic Manufacturing BI&Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to:


  • Gather information and analyze data from various sources and systems
  • Develop process automation flows to streamline operations
  • Support the development of team standards for our digitalization tools
  • Identify opportunities for improvement and optimization in our processes and solutions



We use a range of platforms including Tableau, Alteryx, PowerBI, PowerApps, and PowerAutomate, so you can expect to learn about this spectrum of low-code/no-code tool stack

Practicalities:


  • Internship position for 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to one year
  • Full-time working hours, with flexibility during exam periods
  • August/September as starting date
  • Internships are remunerated if your educational track allows it



Qualifications

To be successful in this internship, we are looking for someone who:


  • Is currently pursuing a university degree or master‚Äôs in business administration, Business Development, Business Analytics, Data science, Digital Design, Engineering or similar.
  • Has a passion for data analytics and process improvement
  • Has basic knowledge of data analysis and visualization
  • Has excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Is fluent in English



We are looking for an Intern who is proactive, collaborative, and structured with high quality standards and the ability to spot opportunities for optimisations. It is an advantage if you have experience with tools such as Alteryx/Tableau/Power BI/PowerApps or coding experience

Please note that a Danish full-time work permit is required for this position.

About The Department

You will be joining our HQ team, which serves as the center of excellence for Business Intelligence & Analytics for all Aseptic Manufacturing (AM). AM is a global production organization with more than 8,000 employees across 4 continents. Our department is responsible for leading strategic and cross-functional projects that involve multiple production sites.

Working at Novo Nordisk

Novo Nordisk is a leading global healthcare company with a 100-year legacy of driving change to defeat serious chronic diseases. Building on our strong legacy within diabetes, we are growing massively and expanding our commitment, reaching millions around the world and impacting more than 40 million patient lives daily. All of this has made us one of the 20 most valuable companies in the world by market cap. Our success relies on the joint potential and collaboration of our more than 63,000 employees around the world. We recognize the importance of the unique skills and perspectives our people bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk, we‚Äôre working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it‚Äôs a collective effort. Join us! Together, we go further. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

Contact and Deadline

For further information, please contact Luisa Katsambi +45 30790278 or Yue Xu +45 34448845 or get to know us better by visiting www.novonordisk.com/careers. Apply by 30th June 2025.

Kindly note that applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews conducted on a rolling basis. Please refrain from adding a photo to your CV to ensure fair and efficient processing.

We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

Title: Student Assistant, Performance Marketing & Data Analysis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world‚Äôs leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We‚Äôre also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

We are on the lookout for a driven, analytical Student Assistant - could that be you? If you enjoy working with data, dashboards, and performance metrics and have dipped your toes into leveraging AI tools to automate workflows - the please read on!

You‚Äôll help our team optimize the performance of well-known travel brands - like momondo, Cheapflights, and KAYAK - by pulling, analyzing, and reporting on key marketing data while also exploring ways to streamline processes using AI-powered tools. This is an excellent opportunity to apply your data analysis skills in a real-world marketing environment. Working closely with leadership in Copenhagen and teams across the globe, you'll gain valuable experience in a dynamic and globally connected environment.

In this role, you will:



Extract, clean, and analyze performance marketing data from various platforms.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators.
Work extensively with Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas, data manipulation).
Support the team with ad hoc data requests and campaign performance analysis.
Assist in A/B testing, capturing and analyzing data to improve campaign results.
Collaborate with performance marketing teams to improve reporting processes.
Document analysis methods and ensure data accuracy across reports.
The average workload is around 15 hours per week, but there‚Äôs a high level of flexibility, especially during exam periods.



Please apply if you have/are:



Currently pursuing a degree with at least one year remaining.
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis, reporting and visualization
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas, and data processing required).
Experience with various AI tools for problem solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal).
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Experience with SQL or other database languages is a plus.
Organized, thorough, and eager to learn.
Enthusiastic, ethical, and a collaborative team player.



If you love working with data, dashboards, and performance insights, then join KAYAK to help shape the future of travel!

Benefits



Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
No meeting Fridays

Focus on your career growth:

Access to thousands of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At KAYAK/momondo, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Demand)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We‚Äôre more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of 118 million registered users and 246,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 443+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.198.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (Demand) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across Operations, Finance, and Marketing teams to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Design and deliver data products within the global operational excellence organization to unlock better operations workflows through automation and improved access to insights.
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in an analytical role
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You have a great understanding of Marketplace health metrics (LTV, CAC, Retention, ROI)
You are familiar with tracking of Marketing/Product initiatives and impact analysis
You are motivated by improving efficiency and effectiveness through automation
You are driven by the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you‚Äôre solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You are strongly proficient in at least one BI/Data Visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
