Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world‚Äôs largest airports rely on Veovo.‚ÄØ Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to ‚Äúgo brilliantly‚Äù.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they‚Äôre big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK,‚ÄØPoland,‚ÄØDenmark, New Zealand and the US,‚ÄØVeovo‚ÄØoffers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ H√¶kken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Director of Business Insights
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Back to jobs

Director of Business Insights

Vejle (Denmark)

Ready to drive the future of the automotive industry with your data expertise? Join AutoProff as our Director of Business Insights and be part of the team leading the change in transforming how we leverage data and create impactful insights.

At AutoProff, we're shaking up the automotive industry with our cutting-edge technology and innovative approach. As a top platform for vehicle trading, we use data to give our clients the insights they need to make smart decisions. Our dedication to excellence and forward-thinking mindset has put us at the forefront of the market.

About The Role

We're on the lookout for a passionate and strategic Director of Business Insights to lead our business insights and shape our analytical vision within financial, commercial and operational performance. In this role, you'll be a vital part to execute our data strategy, making sure we use data in a consistent way to guide business decisions, improve customer experiences, and drive growth.

As our new Director of Business Insights, you‚Äôll report directly to our CFO, making you an essential pillar of our success. Your expertise will be pivotal in propelling AutoProff towards continuous growth and development.

If you're passionate about innovation, growth, and being part of a dynamic team, this opportunity is tailor-made for you. Embrace this chance to contribute to our ongoing success, and let's create something extraordinary together!

Your Areas Of Responsibility Will Cover The Following Areas


Define, develop and own AutoProff Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards and standardized analyses that facilitate informed decision-making across core business functions, including Operations and Finance.
Be a crucial part of defining and implementing the AutoProff Business insights roadmap focused on enhancing business performance, commercial performance, and understanding and analyzing operational performance.
Provide insights to guide and drive commercial decisions and optimization in collaboration with commercial teams.
Democratize data across the organization through purpose build tools including the possibilities within providing data through custom AI chatbots and AI solutions for improved data accessibility.
Serve as a key member of the AutoProff Data Governance Council, collaborating to co-own the data strategy alongside the Product and Technology teams.
Ensure KPIs are being defined according to business standards and used in a consistent way across AutoProff.
Prepare reporting towards AutoProff board, executive management and commercial leadership team.
Support the transition to a new BI tool together with the technical leads.
Actively participates in our Data Analytics Guild, fostering collaboration and contributing to the collective expertise and growth of our data analytics community.
Manage and develop a small team, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.


The Need-to-have Skills


Educational background could be a master's degree within relevant field, but most important is a proven track record of supporting business growth through analytics and insights.
Good stakeholder Management skills and capable of understanding both technical and business needs.
Managerial skills or interest in becoming an excellent people manager.
Ability to convert business needs into value creating insights for the business on operational, tactical and strategic level.
Ability to create transparency of development pipeline and drive prioritization.
Comfortable writing SQL scripts (e.g. within Athena, Presto or similar tools), to extract the data that is required for reporting.


You Will Thrive In This Role If


You are proactive with buckets of positive energy and can think outside the box when faced with complex problems.
Brings a curios mindset and like to explore the patterns in data that can shape business decisions.
Have a natural curiosity in business optimization through data insight and gets motivated by shaping business decisions.
Likes to impact business management and decisions through a mindset.
Like a dynamic and high paced culture, where we pave the road as we drive.
Like to have fun with your colleagues and enjoys an informal work environment.
Confident with taking the lead and make the decisions


About AutoProff

AutoProff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AutoProff‚Äôs online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based trading, and car transportation) or sell cars via AutoProff‚Äôs fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

AutoProff also provides C2B web solutions for dealerships, internal digital trading solutions for larger dealership groups and their ecosystems, as well as dedicated enterprise solutions for leasing, rental and insurance firms. More information on www.autoproff.com

Director of Business Insights

Vejle (Denmark)

Ready to drive the future of the automotive industry with your data expertise? Join AutoProff as our Director of Business Insights and be part of the team leading the change in transforming how we leverage data and create impactful insights.

At AutoProff, we're shaking up the automotive industry with our cutting-edge technology and innovative approach. As a top platform for vehicle trading, we use data to give our clients the insights they need to make smart decisions. Our dedication to excellence and forward-thinking mindset has put us at the forefront of the market.

About The Role

We're on the lookout for a passionate and strategic Director of Business Insights to lead our business insights and shape our analytical vision within financial, commercial and operational performance. In this role, you'll be a vital part to execute our data strategy, making sure we use data in a consistent way to guide business decisions, improve customer experiences, and drive growth.

As our new Director of Business Insights, you‚Äôll report directly to our CFO, making you an essential pillar of our success. Your expertise will be pivotal in propelling AutoProff towards continuous growth and development.

If you're passionate about innovation, growth, and being part of a dynamic team, this opportunity is tailor-made for you. Embrace this chance to contribute to our ongoing success, and let's create something extraordinary together!

Your Areas Of Responsibility Will Cover The Following Areas

  • Define, develop and own AutoProff Business Intelligence (BI) dashboards and standardized analyses that facilitate informed decision-making across core business functions, including Operations and Finance.
  • Be a crucial part of defining and implementing the AutoProff Business insights roadmap focused on enhancing business performance, commercial performance, and understanding and analyzing operational performance.
  • Provide insights to guide and drive commercial decisions and optimization in collaboration with commercial teams.
  • Democratize data across the organization through purpose build tools including the possibilities within providing data through custom AI chatbots and AI solutions for improved data accessibility.
  • Serve as a key member of the AutoProff Data Governance Council, collaborating to co-own the data strategy alongside the Product and Technology teams.
  • Ensure KPIs are being defined according to business standards and used in a consistent way across AutoProff.
  • Prepare reporting towards AutoProff board, executive management and commercial leadership team.
  • Support the transition to a new BI tool together with the technical leads.
  • Actively participates in our Data Analytics Guild, fostering collaboration and contributing to the collective expertise and growth of our data analytics community.
  • Manage and develop a small team, fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement.

The Need-to-have Skills

  • Educational background could be a master's degree within relevant field, but most important is a proven track record of supporting business growth through analytics and insights.
  • Good stakeholder Management skills and capable of understanding both technical and business needs.
  • Managerial skills or interest in becoming an excellent people manager.
  • Ability to convert business needs into value creating insights for the business on operational, tactical and strategic level.
  • Ability to create transparency of development pipeline and drive prioritization.
  • Comfortable writing SQL scripts (e.g. within Athena, Presto or similar tools), to extract the data that is required for reporting.

You Will Thrive In This Role If

  • You are proactive with buckets of positive energy and can think outside the box when faced with complex problems.
  • Brings a curios mindset and like to explore the patterns in data that can shape business decisions.
  • Have a natural curiosity in business optimization through data insight and gets motivated by shaping business decisions.
  • Likes to impact business management and decisions through a mindset.
  • Like a dynamic and high paced culture, where we pave the road as we drive.
  • Like to have fun with your colleagues and enjoys an informal work environment.
  • Confident with taking the lead and make the decisions

About AutoProff

AutoProff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AutoProff‚Äôs online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based trading, and car transportation) or sell cars via AutoProff‚Äôs fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

AutoProff also provides C2B web solutions for dealerships, internal digital trading solutions for larger dealership groups and their ecosystems, as well as dedicated enterprise solutions for leasing, rental and insurance firms. More information on www.autoproff.com

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst for Revenue Operations
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Department: RevOps

Location: Copenhagen



Description

‚ÄãTransform Data into Strategic Advantage
At Factbird, we're redefining the manufacturing IoT space with our innovative data collection and production monitoring solutions. We empower manufacturers to achieve new levels of efficiency and profitability by providing real-time insights into their operations. As a growing scale-up with a global footprint, we offer an environment that blends innovation, collaboration, and fun with professional excellence.

We are now looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Revenue Operations team and to take ownership of our data infrastructure and play a strategic role in driving Factbird‚Äôs growth journey forward.
‚Äã

Your Mission
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be the owner of Factbird‚Äôs commercial data stack, spanning from data ingestion to strategic insight generation. You will work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success and Finance to ensure that our leadership and frontline teams have access to the right data at the right time to inform decisions and accelerate growth.

You will not just manage data ‚Äî you will enable Factbird to leverage it commercially, spotting opportunities and identifying key drivers of business performance.

Key Responsibilities


Own and evolve the data infrastructure: Oversee the end-to-end management of our Data Warehouse (BigQuery) and Power BI ecosystem, ensuring data integrity, scalability, and performance.
Lead data strategy: Develop and implement best practices for data governance, security, and quality.
Generate commercial insights: Translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations across the customer lifecycle ‚Äî from lead generation to revenue retention.
Optimize reporting frameworks: Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools to deliver critical KPIs to commercial leadership and the executive team.
Business partnering: Collaborate closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to drive revenue optimization through data-driven strategies.
Advanced analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis on commercial and financial performance, pipeline trends, sales efficiency, customer segmentation, churn, and expansion opportunities.
Develop predictive models: Apply advanced analytics and forecasting models to inform strategic initiatives.
Champion a data-driven culture: Promote the use of data as a core pillar for decision-making across the commercial organization.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise


3‚Äì5 years of experience in Revenue Operations, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or similar roles in a B2B SaaS or tech-driven environment.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong technical foundation in SQL (BigQuery/GoogleSQL), Power BI, and Python (or similar scripting languages).
Demonstrated experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and data pipeline management.
Proven ability to deliver commercially impactful insights ‚Äî you think business-first, not just data-first.
Solid understanding of SaaS business models, pipeline metrics, revenue forecasting, and sales and marketing funnels.
Excellent communication skills; able to explain complex technical topics to non-technical audiences.
Experience with CRM and Marketing Automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce) is a plus.
Strong organizational and project management skills ‚Äî able to prioritize and drive multiple initiatives simultaneously.


Why Join Factbird?¬†


Flexible working hours and hybrid work options.
Be part of a successful growth company enabling professional as well as personal development.
A competitive salary reflecting your expertise and impact.
Structured and supportive onboarding process.
You choose your gear ‚Äî work with what inspires you.
Be part of an international and diverse team with colleagues from 17+ nationalities.
Thrive in a collaborative, innovative, and fun environment in the heart of vibrant Copenhagen.

Ready to own and scale our commercial data infrastructure and unlock new growth opportunities? Apply today and become part of the Factbird journey.

Questions? Reach out to Khristel Marie Aparicio at khma@factbird.com.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data & Automation Engineer




PNO Group, Copenhagen




PNO is the Nordic‚Äôs largest trailer rental company. We are a family-owned company established in 1975 with our head oce in Copenhagen, and with branches in Germany, Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark & the Netherlands.




At PNO, we are looking for smart people who are curious at heart and always looking for new ways of doing things. In a nutshell, we are a human-centred organisation looking for team players who bring their honest selves to work every day.




About the job




We are looking for a tech savvy individual to take our data and automation setup to the next level. Over the past years we have built up base infrastructure for data and reporting mainly using PowerBI, PostgreSQL, Azure data factory and Databricks.




We are now looking for someone to help take that to the next level especially focusing more on data sync and alignment between systems including automation of that.




You will be required to have an eye on the strategic aspect in terms of how we structure our data landscape and connect systems, but still enjoy spending most of your time with getting your hands dirty developing pipelines and automations.




You‚Äôll play a central role in syncing and aligning data between systems and automating where it really matters. You care about impact, not complexity, and are able to make strategic calls about where to focus, while being hands-on with implementation.




One day you might be helping design how we align data models between our ERP and CRM, while you the other day will code robots to handle data in our AP system.




Skills, experience and background




5+ years Data engineering experience with ETL/ELT pipeline development and data architecture.
Comfortable navigating real world, resource-constrained environment and prioritising what moves the needle.
Knowledge of all or some of PowerBI, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and PostgreSQL, Power Automate.
Experience working with a stack of loosely connected cloud systems and using scripts, APIs, automated browser robots and similar to bridge the gaps.
Proven ability to design practical data models that connect operational and commercial systems (e.g. ERP and CRM).
A sharp, structured thinker who values rational decision-making and can clearly communicate trade-offs.
Strong ownership mindset and an instinct for simple, high-leverage solutions over engineering.




We invest in your success




An organization with a dynamic team of smart and thoughtful individuals.
A team-first culture with high ambition and low ego.
Competitive salary and meaningful work.
Regular coaching from experienced leaders.




If you‚Äôre excited by this opportunity and see yourself in this role, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst for Performance Management (H/F) - SATAIR A/S
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description: Do you want to improve the performance and customer satisfaction of the Aftermarket division of Airbus? What the job isThis role, based in Copenhagen, reports to the Head of Performance Management (ASAXP) and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our Operations functions, Sales, Product Management, Finance, HR, and IT Teams from all our sites in the world. You will integrate the Business Performance team which is spread across the globe, matching Satair's operational footprint. It means working in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams with a focus and responsibility on delivering pragmatic solutions. We are looking for our new Process & Performance Manager who is ready to roll up their sleeves and help us develop actionable, data-driven insights and solve business problems, using various quantitative tools and core project management skills. The candidate will challenge the status quo as well as be resolutely determined to ensure operational excellence by speeding implementation across the organization to make a difference in terms of performance perceived by customers. Key deliverables:


Lead Customer Performance Improvement projects with the aim of reducing/eradicating customer Irritants
work directly with customers to understand pain points from a data driven perspective in collaboration with our Sales organization
Translate customer satisfaction expectations into operational targets
Deploy Airbus Continuous Improvement initiates (Called Airbus Operating System - AOS) deployment in Satair in close collaboration with Airbus Customer Services AOS team (S function) and Satair Functions.
Support operational functions in their AOS/continuous improvement deployment
Benchmarking across the company
How you will contribute to the teamKey competencies needed to succeed in this position


Strong analytical & Problem Solving: Demonstrate exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving skills in an industrial environment, to structure ambiguous situations and to use data analysis to the extent possible to find and drive solutions.
Delivering Results: Ability to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions in complex organisation under tight timelines, working through the multiple constraints along the way with agility .
Influencing and foster collaboration: Innovative leader with the ability to identify opportunities and influence / challenge stakeholders with unbiased view across all functions to gain support and overcome resistance with trustful collaboration, data, persuasion and common goals.
Data Analysis Skills: Experience in Python, including data manipulation and analysis libraries Familiarity with database systems and SQL Ability to visualize and communicate data and analyses
Excellent communication (especially in English): Ability to create synthetic and precise status reports with internal and cross functional teams for reviews with executive and senior leadership teams synthesizing large quantities of data to help create new, step-change initiatives for the organisation. Communicate expectations and requirements equally well at all levels, and capacity to write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as necessary
What does your next challenge look like?At Satair, we believe in sustainable aviation that allows people to travel and connect across the globe. We are on a mission to provide world class material solutions that keep aircraft flying and extend their lifespan. In Satair, you can challenge the status quo, pioneer new ways of working, and generate real value for airlines and suppliers worldwide. Being part of the Airbus family gives us the opportunity to live a global mindset, working in international teams and collaborating across functions, sites and cultures. If you want to work as one team embracing a can-do attitude in a demanding environment, then we offer a great place to explore, learn, and grow. Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company! About SATAIRSatair offers first class material management solutions in the aftermarket business of the aviation industry. We are working to be the most customer-centric organization in providing commercial aviation spares parts to make the world continue flying. We are constantly taking customer experience to new levels by improving how we fulfill and deliver customers‚Äô orders quickly and accurately, anywhere in the world. To meet this goal, Satair is continually striving to innovate and provide best-in-class service levels by pioneering new products and services in a fast growing business environment. With our global functional organization spanning across 11 different sites and locations worldwide with more than 1.800 people and a turnover of $3.0 billion, you will be part of a truly global family. Our customers have the ultimate goal to operate their fleet and our Airbus aircraft safely, efficiently in a cost-time-quality effective manner and of course with the expected comfort level for their customers. We at Satair do everything to support our customers in this. If you want to know more about our business, have a closer look at our website www.SATAIR.com or check out our SATAIR Youtube Channel at www.youtube.com/sataircompany ! What do we offer at SATAIR?At SATAIR, you will find much more than a job - we offer you the possibility of growing both your personal and professional capacities in a fun, supportive and informal working environment, where you will be encouraged to engage, share knowledge and ideas. SATAIR is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We love to bring in people with different backgrounds and experiences as we believe it enhances our performance immensely! Here is a selection of some of the benefits we offer our employees in Copenhagen:


Competitive remuneration, including short term incentive bonus on all levels
Work/life balance: hybrid working, flex time, maternity/paternity/parental leave, 29 days of holiday + senior and flex days
Personal development: personalized development plans, large portfolio of learning solutions and many internal mobility opportunities, both locally and globally
Health and well-being: Health insurance, in-house canteen with many healthy options
Come on board and join us at Satair, an Airbus Services Company Please send us your application as soon as possible to get the opportunity to become part of an exceptional global team! We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. When applying for the position, you accept our data privacy statement: http://www.SATAIR.com/privacy This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company‚Äôs success, reputation and sustainable growth.Company: Satair A/SContract Type:PermanentExperience Level:ProfessionalJob Family:Digital By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Title: Senior Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
üëã Welcome to Hi Rasmus!

At Hi Rasmus, people are at the heart of everything we do. Whether you're just joining us or have been part of our journey, we‚Äôre excited to have you on board!




We‚Äôre on a mission to make evidence-based autism care accessible to families everywhere. üåç Families shouldn‚Äôt have to uproot their lives to access support‚Äîthat‚Äôs why we break down barriers while keeping the human touch at the center of our work. Our goal? To positively impact the lives of 1 million children with autism.




Rooted in a culture that values trust, collaboration, and balance, we foster a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered.




üéØ Our Core Values

üîπ Innovation üß† ‚Äì We embrace creativity and seek better solutions.

üì¢ About the Role

Job Title: Senior Data & Insights Analyst

Location: Remote; Denmark-based

Job Type: Full-Time

Compensation: $100,000 - $120,000 annually




üßë‚Äçüíª About You

You are a data-driven leader with expertise in business intelligence and a passion for turning complex data into strategic insights that drive real-world impact.¬†You thrive in complex, fast-paced environments and are driven by a passion for data-driven decision-making. As a seasoned professional in business intelligence, your leadership will drive the integration and optimization of data reporting solutions that scale with our company‚Äôs growth. You're comfortable with technical execution and collaborating cross-functionally to ensure Hi Rasmus‚Äô clinical outcomes and business reporting is optimized for scalability and impact.




üìå What You‚Äôll Do:

‚úÖ Outcomes Reporting & Impact ‚Äì Help drive the strategy and development of clinical decision making, serving as the primary expert and primary stakeholder in collaboration with clinical, product, and engineering teams to ensure seamless integration across dashboards and reporting systems.

‚úÖ Advanced Analytics Leadership ‚Äì Lead the development of advanced analytics solutions, integrating them into dashboards, reports, and other deliverables that provide clear insights and guide decision-making at all levels.

‚úÖ Strategic Insights Development ‚Äì Work with stakeholders to translate data into actionable insights that guide clinical and business strategies, ensuring data drives meaningful data-driven decision making.

‚úÖ Platform Collaboration ‚Äì Work cross-functionally with clinical, product, engineering, and marketing teams to ensure advanced analytics and insights data is effectively represented and integrated across all Hi Rasmus products.

‚úÖ Data Quality Assurance ‚Äì Maintain high standards for data integrity, consistency, and accuracy in all reporting systems. Lead QA processes and troubleshoot data discrepancies.

‚úÖ Impact Score Development ‚Äì Oversee the creation of HiQ metrics and organizational-level impact scores to assess and track platform effectiveness.

‚úÖ Process Improvement ‚Äì Continuously improve reporting processes to enhance scalability, performance, and user experience.

‚úÖ Stakeholder Communication ‚Äì Work closely with marketing, sales, and customer success teams to ensure the successful deployment of outcomes reporting and advanced analytics solutions.

‚úÖ Training & Support ‚Äì Provide training and ongoing support to internal teams and external users on best practices for advanced analytics solutions.




üéØ What You Bring:

üåü Advanced BI Tool Knowledge ‚Äì Expertise in BI tools, particularly Tableau, with a focus on advanced dashboard development, data integration, and performance optimization.

üåü Strategic Data Insights ‚Äì Experience in translating data into strategic insights, with a focus on driving impact across both clinical and business data-driven decision making.

üåü Data Integration & SQL ‚Äì Strong experience with SQL for querying and optimizing complex datasets, along with expertise in integrating data across systems and platforms, including unstructured data.

üåü ETL Processes ‚Äì Understanding of ETL processes, even if manual or semi-automated, ensuring data flows seamlessly across systems.

üåü Data Modeling & Dashboard Design ‚Äì Experience in designing visual dashboards and reports for both technical and non-technical audiences.

üåü Analytical Thinking ‚Äì Strong ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights for a range of stakeholders.

üåü Leadership & Cross-Functional Collaboration ‚Äì Experience leading data reporting initiatives and working collaboratively across product, engineering, and commercial teams to ensure alignment and impact

üåü Communication Skills ‚Äì Strong presentation and communication skills, capable of explaining complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

üåüNice to Have:

Experience with outcomes reporting and impact analytics, particularly in healthcare, autism, or behavioral science settings.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), especially BigQuery
Experience with Python or R for data processing and analysis
Knowledge of data governance best practices
Experience working with product data or SaaS applications with flexible data models




üíô Perks & Benefits You'll Love

üéì Growth & Development:

Professional development opportunities
Room for growth within the company

üè° Work Style That Works for You:

Fully remote and flexible work environment‚Äîwork from wherever feels right!
Opportunity to make a meaningful impact in the Autism healthcare space

Title: Advanced Data Analysis & Insights Professional
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have experience in creating valuable insights through Data Analysis and visualization? Are you ready to take on the challenge of developing the future structure of Data & Forecast within Novo Nordisk‚Äôs Aseptic Manufacturing Science and Technology Quality Control (AMSAT QC)? Are you passion-ate about driving data excellence and operational continuity?

If you possess the requisite skills and a dedicated mindset, we encourage you to apply and join us in shaping the future together!

The Position

As our Advanced Data Analysis & Insights Professional, you will have a pivotal role in driving data solu-tions and enhancing transparency within AMSAT QC. This position involves close collaboration with vari-ous stakeholders to ensure operational continuity and provide valuable insights for decision-making.

Your responsibilities would be:



Develop innovative data solutions to provide new business insights and enhance transparency of strategic AMSAT QC performance parameters.
Collaborate with global IT experts to optimize existing systems (e.g., PEMS, SAP, ADA, Alteryx) for productive outcomes and user-friendly data solutions.
Analyse data to identify improvement areas and ensure tools enable the QC organization to ef-fectively utilize data for decision-making.
Promote a data-driven decision-making culture through training and support for the implementa-tion of analytics tools across user competencies.
Act as the end-to-end data & analytics owner for small-scale projects, creating dashboards and maintaining a deep understanding of business objectives and analytics trends.




Qualifications

To be successful in this role we would expect you to have:



Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in business information, computer science, data science, or a relat-ed field with analytics focus
+3 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, and strong understanding of data modelling concepts, data visualization best practices, and expertise in tools like Alteryx, Tableau, or PowerBI
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to drive strategic analytics solutions
Fast adaptability to a rapidly evolving environment, with the ability to think strategically about analytics and its impact on business value
Preferably some proficiency in SQL, Python, or similar programming languages
Professional proficiency in written and spoken English




About The Department

You will be joining our highly motivated department, consisting of committed professionals and manag-ers. Our primary task is to develop sustainable operational excellence flow to support 7 QC Labs in Denmark which will lead us to reach out our OneQC target.

As a member of the Data & Forecast team, you will play a crucial role in supporting QC Labs in various locations and ensuring their stable operation. We value teamwork and collaboration, and we take great responsibility for our day-to-day operations. Join us and be part of a team that is dedicated to achieving our common goals.

Working at Novo Nordisk‚ÄØ

At Novo Nordisk, we don‚Äôt wait for change. We drive it. We‚Äôre a dynamic company in an even more dy-namic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales ‚Äì we‚Äôre all working to move the nee-dle on patient care.

Contact

For further information about the role, please contact Manager in Quality Control Demet Alacam at DTAA@novonordisk.com

Deadline

29 June 2025

Applications will be reviewed, and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis therefore do not hesi-tate to apply if interested.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. Please upload your CV in English, and to ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore commit-ted to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we‚Äôre life changing.

Title: Student Worker, Trial Analytics & Visualization
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Genmab, we are dedicated to building extra[not]ordinary¬Æ futures, together, by developing antibody products and groundbreaking, knock-your-socks-off KYSO antibody medicines¬Æ that change lives and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. We strive to create, champion and maintain a global workplace where individuals‚Äô unique contributions are valued and drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our patients, care partners, families and employees.

Our people are compassionate, candid, and purposeful, and our business is innovative and rooted in science. We believe that being proudly authentic and determined to be our best is essential to fulfilling our purpose. Yes, our work is incredibly serious and impactful, but we have big ambitions, bring a ton of care to pursuing them, and have a lot of fun while doing so.

Does this inspire you and feel like a fit? Then we would love to have you join us!

The Role

We are looking for a Student Worker to play a key role in supporting the Trial Analytics & Visualization Team within Development Operations. You will assist the Head of Department (HoD), Team Leads, and other stakeholders with a wide range of administrative, quality, and development tasks related to ongoing clinical trials and departmental activities. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and data-driven environment, contributing to meaningful advancements in clinical development.

This role offers a unique opportunity to gain experience in clinical operations, data analytics, and cross-functional collaboration in a global healthcare setting. If you are motivated by making a real-world impact through data and operations, we would love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Trial Insights ‚Äì Administration and Development
Assist in the release and maintenance of a portfolio of data visualization dashboards.
Support quality documentation efforts, including QMS and TMF documents in GenDocs.
Assist in preparing periodic reviews and documenting training activities.
Maintain and update training and access matrices.
Provide logistical support for trial-specific application setups (e.g., meeting coordination, drafting minutes).
Help track trial budgets and support invoicing processes.
Contribute to the development and testing of Trial Insights applications.
Trial Insights ‚Äì Quality Control
Perform quality control tasks to ensure accurate and consistent data dashboards.
Troubleshoot and resolve dataflow issues in collaboration with the IT Service Desk.
Conduct spot checks to verify consistency of operational data sources across dashboards.
Assist in the creation of administrative tools for dataflow monitoring and data validation.
General Support ‚Äì GenOps Activities
Provide backup support to GenOps team members on trial-related operational tasks.
Coordinate meetings, support Clinical Trial Managers and Study Operations Leads with administrative needs.
Upload trial documents to eDoc and GenDocs.
Contract Management
Support Clinical Trial Administrators with contract cover sheet preparation.
Assist with the contract signature process and ensure timely archiving with Legal.
Maintain and update contract tracking and status overviews.
Departmental Support
Assist with audit and inspection preparation, including organizing and printing materials.
Arrange travel logistics and prepare associated expense reports as needed.
Perform other relevant tasks as assigned by your supervisor.


Requirements


Strong planning and organizational skills
Attention to detail and a quality-driven mindset
Experience with document management and structured workflows
Solid written communication skills in English
Programming skills (e.g., Python, R, or similar) are a plus
Proactive and collaborative attitude


About You


You are genuinely passionate about our purpose
You bring precision and excellence to all that you do
You believe in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with a broad spectrum of backgrounds
You take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
You can grapple with the unknown and be innovative
You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so!


Locations

Genmab maximizes the efficiency of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are crafted as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our powerful laboratories. Whether you‚Äôre in one of our office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.

About Genmab

Genmab is an international biotechnology company with a core purpose to improve the lives of patients through innovative and differentiated antibody therapeutics. For 25 years, its hard-working, innovative and collaborative team has invented next-generation antibody technology platforms and harnessed translational, quantitative and data sciences, resulting in a proprietary pipeline including bispecific T-cell engagers, antibody-drug conjugates, next-generation immune checkpoint modulators and effector function-enhanced antibodies. By 2030, Genmab‚Äôs vision is to transform the lives of people with cancer and other serious diseases with Knock-Your-Socks-Off (KYSO¬Æ) antibody medicines.

Established in 1999, Genmab is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark with international presence across North America, Europe and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit Genmab.com and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website Job Applicant Privacy Notice (genmab.com).

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data analysis and financial markets? Would you like a job where your work directly contributes to the immediate success of your team? Then apply now to become our new Quantative Analyst and start your career within the epicenter of power trading!

¬†

Power Trading Analyst

As a Quantative Analyst you will join our analysis team. Here you will play a pivotal role in both the development and maintenance of our trading tools and in shaping our trading strategies. Collaborating closely with your colleagues in the analysis team and our 24/7 intraday trading team, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our trading operations and ensuring our strategies are data-driven and effective. Your key responsibilities will include:

Developing, implementing, and maintaining trading tools using Python, SQL, and occasionally Excel and VBA
Collaborating closely with the trading team to understand their needs and provide analytical support
Designing and implementing trading strategies based on thorough market analysis and insights
Engaging in continuous learning to stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices
Offering backup and support for critical tasks and processes, ensuring seamless trading operations

¬†

About You

You have a proactive and curious nature, always eager to delve deeper into data
You are detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality
You have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapting to changing priorities
You are a genuine team-player, valuing the collective strength of collaborative efforts
You have a Bachelor's, Master's degree, or PhD in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
You are proficient in Python, SQL, and/or other programming languages. Experience with Excel and VBA is a plus
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to develop and implement trading strategies. Perhaps you have a keen interest in machine learning and its applications in a trading setup?
You possess excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate across teams and present complex data in an understandable manner
You are fluent in English, both written and spoken

¬†

What We Offer

A dynamic young work environment with opportunities for professional growth
Collaboration with a dedicated and passionate team of professionals
Competitive compensation
A unique company culture that values innovation, dedication, and collaboration
A responsible employer with emphasis and focus on compliance
An opportunity to join one of the fastest growing industries in Aarhus
An office at Katrinebjerg, part of the vibrant IT community near Aarhus University

¬†

About Us

Inductive Energy is an energy trading company specialized in predicting short-term price movements in the European energy markets. Our primary focus is on the European intraday power markets, where we have an expanding portfolio of markets that we trade proprietarily. We love markets, energy, and trading, and we are passionate about building a trading floor where these things come together. Our journey is continuing, and we are looking for ambitious individuals to join us!




Apply to us now, at job@inductive-energy.dk. Please include your CV, motivational letter, and academic results. We review applications continuously, and you can start as soon as possible!

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Mantell Associates is partnered with a pioneering MedTech organisation that is transforming biotech workflows through Robotics, AI, and Cloud infrastructure.




This business is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to help drive innovation through data integration, ETL automation, and cloud-native architecture. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing, mission-driven team focused on redefining the future of biotech R&D and clinical development.




Data Engineer - Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable ETL pipelines using Python to support real-time and batch data workflows
Architect and manage cloud-native data solutions using AWS (including Lambda, S3, Redshift, and related services)
Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and integrity
Develop and maintain data models and warehouse structures to support analytics and operational decision-making
Perform advanced data wrangling, transformation, and validation across structured and unstructured datasets
Monitor data pipeline performance and implement enhancements for reliability, security, and scalability
Document architecture and contribute to best practices across the data engineering function




Data Engineer ‚Äì Requirements:

4‚Äì6+ years of experience in a Data Engineering role, ideally within Biotech, MedTech, HealthTech, or Life Sciences
Strong hands-on expertise with AWS services including Lambda, S3, Redshift, Glue, and related technologies
Advanced proficiency in Python for building ETL pipelines and automation workflows
Deep understanding of SQL, data modeling, and data warehouse architecture
Experience working with complex biological or healthcare data preferred
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong attention to detail
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, innovative environment




Mantell Associates is a specialist Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences headhunting firm. For more information on this opportunity, contact us at +44 (0)20 3854 7700.

Title: Business Insights & Reporting Specialist
Description:
deugro was founded in Frankfurt am Main and is the first company of the deugro group, where is has its focus on global project freight forwarding. Every day the industry and deugro face the challenges of the logistics industry and our employees use their expertise to ensure large cargo is transported safely, effectively, and efficiently, through innovative and creative logistical solutions.




Become a part of our talented deugro team, as we look for a Business Insights & Reporting Specialist in Aarhus, Denmark




Key Responsibilities:

Business Reporting & Analysis

Develop and maintain regular reports and dashboards that provide a holistic view of business performance, including operational, strategic, and commercial metrics specific to freight forwarding
Synthesize data from multiple sources (Power BI, CargoWise, Project management tools, manual inputs, etc.) into clear, actionable insights
Prepare executive-level reporting packs that include narrative summaries, visualizations, and strategic commentary




Commercial & Strategic Insights

Track and report on commercial initiatives, market developments, and partnership performance within the freight forwarding sector
Support strategic planning cycles with data-backed insights and scenario modeling
Conduct ad hoc analysis to support business cases, investment decisions, and strategic reviews

Revenue & Pipeline Monitoring

Collaborate with Sales, operations, and Finance to monitor revenue performance, sales pipeline health, and customer trends
Identify risks and opportunities in revenue streams and provide early warnings or recommendations

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Act as a liaison between business units to ensure consistent and aligned reporting practices
Translate complex data into business-friendly language for non-technical stakeholders
Support internal communications with reporting that highlights progress on key initiatives and goals




Skills, knowledge and expertise:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or a related field
5+ years of experience in business reporting, commercial analysis, or strategic planning
Experience in the freight forwarding or logistics industry
Strong proficiency in reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Excel, others) and data visualization
Familiarity with CRM and ERP systems
Strong business acumen and curiosity about how different functions contribute to overall performance
Strategic thinker with a structured and self-driven approach
Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing multiple data sources
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling business narratives




What makes us the ideal choice?

A family-owned company established in 1924, has evolved into a leading global specialist in project freight forwarding. Our expertise spans various cargo types including break bulk, out of gauge, dangerous goods, and oversized shipments. Complementing our core services are affiliated entities specializing in transport engineering solutions, global ocean transportation, and specialized transportation assets.




We take pride in our commitment to employees, offering opportunities for long-term career growth, hybrid work arrangements, and flexible scheduling options.




We eagerly seek candidates who possess enthusiasm, passion, and innovative thinking, valuing their ability to translate ideas into action through dedication rather than solely relying on their resume or career history.




We value diversity and welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic or social origin, religion, disability, age and sexual orientation.




deugro (Deutschland) Projekt GmbH

Arpitha Bairapatna Giriyappa

Cremon 3, Hamburg, HH 20457 DEU




www.deugro.com

Title: D365 Power BI Consultant
Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Power BI Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data migration, data modelling, and report/dashboard development, along with hands-on experience in SSIS, T-SQL, and integration with Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (D365 CE). This role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business decisions and performance.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Build and optimize data models using Power BI, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Perform data migration tasks across legacy systems and target data warehouses or cloud platforms.
Create ETL processes using SSIS to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Integrate and extract data from Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE.
Write and optimize complex T-SQL queries for data analysis and transformation.
Collaborate with business analysts, data engineers, and stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver impactful BI solutions.
Troubleshoot and resolve data and performance issues.
Follow best practices for BI solution design, including security, performance, and scalability.

Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years of experience with Power BI, including DAX and Power Query.
Strong experience in data modelling, especially in star/snowflake schema design.
Proven experience with data migration projects and tools.
Advanced knowledge of SSIS for ETL development.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE data structures and APIs.
Strong command of T-SQL, including query tuning and stored procedures.
Familiarity with data governance, security models, and row-level security in Power BI.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.

Preferred Qualifications:

Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or equivalent.
Experience with Azure Data Services (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL).
Knowledge of Agile methodologies and working in DevOps environments.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst ‚Äì North American Energy Markets

Location: Aarhus, Denmark

Team: North American Power Trading

Position Type: Full-time

Start Date: ASAP




We‚Äôre seeking an experienced quant with North American power market expertise to help scale a growing real-time trading desk. You‚Äôll design and refine region-specific strategies, working closely with global teams in a hands-on role that directly impacts performance and team growth.




Key Responsibilities




Help establish and grow a new trading unit focused on the North American power markets
Leverage your prior experience in trading or analysis of North American power markets to coach and mentor colleagues
Develop and implement quantitative trading strategies in a fast-paced, competitive environment
Monitor market dynamics, regulatory changes, and short-term fundamentals to identify trading opportunities
Contribute to continuous development of the team‚Äôs analytical and trading frameworks
Actively manage risk and return on intraday and short-term positions




Your Profile




At least 2 years of relevant experience as a trader or quantitative analyst focused on North American power markets
Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, physics, computer science, or engineering
Strong programming skills, particularly in Python
High level of numeracy and analytical thinking
Proactive, independent, and organized in your work style
A collaborative team player who thrives in a flat-structured, idea-driven environment
Eager to take ownership, push boundaries, and contribute to team success
Entrepreneurial mindset with a drive to challenge conventions and deliver results




What They Offer




A collaborative, high-energy work culture with a strong sense of ownership and ambition
Immediate responsibility and continuous learning in a supportive environment
Opportunities for fast-track career progression and personal development
Direct influence on the direction and buildout of a new trading initiative
Competitive compensation package
Frequent social activities and team-building events, including sports, celebrations, and weekly gatherings
Well-equipped office space in a central European city, with high-quality catering and wellness perks

Schneider Electric is a global leader in energy management and automation, driving innovative and sustainable technologies across homes, buildings, data centers, infrastructure, and industries. As part of our mission to shape the future of sustainable energy, we‚Äôre also transforming how we manage and support our people and business leaders. What You'll Be Doing:‚ÄØ¬†

Collaborate with HR Business Partners, HR Services, Finance, and Digital teams to ensure data integrity and actionable insights.¬†
Identify opportunities for automation and process standardization¬†
Support HR transformation projects with strong project management and stakeholder communication.¬†
Ensure compliance with HR data standards and regulatory requirements.¬†

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

What Will Help You Succeed:‚ÄØ¬†

Master‚Äôs degree in HR, Data Analytics, Business Analytics, or related field.¬†
Minimum 3 years of experience in HR data analysis, HR systems, or HR transformation.¬†
Strong technical skills in‚ÄØTableau,‚ÄØPython, and data visualization.¬†
Experience with HRIS systems and data extraction techniques.¬†
Solid understanding of HR processes and metrics.¬†
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to business leaders.¬†
Experience in project management is a plus.¬†
Fluent in English and a Nordic language.¬†

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

What Do We Offer:‚ÄØ¬†

At Schneider Electric, we are committed to fostering a vibrant and inclusive work culture where every employee is empowered to thrive. As part of our team, you can expect:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

Professional Growth:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

Be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that encourages creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit as we lead the way in digital transformation and sustainability.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineer Trainee
Place: K√∏benhavn SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a motivated student with a passion for data and a desire to learn the ropes of data engineering?

We are looking for a curious and proactive Student Assistant to join our team and embark on a journey into the world of data engineering. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience, learn from experienced professionals, and contribute to meaningful data projects within a dynamic international company. You'll also be supported every step of the way with a dedicated, experienced engineer mentor to guide you on this exciting journey.


About The Job



What you will learn and do:




Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines.
Learn about data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Work with various data tools and technologies used in a professional environment.
Collaborate with data engineers and data scientists on exciting projects.
Gain practical experience in a real-world data engineering setting.
Develop your skills in cloud platforms.


You will be stepping into an international team located in Copenhagen & Warsaw. This position is based in Copenhagen, Denmark

At Falck, we prioritize creating a positive work culture. Our team enjoys regular team-building activities, social events. The student position is 20 hours per week, with the possibility of flexibility to make room for study and work.

Join us and be part of a team that's shaping the future of data in healthcare in a collaborative work environment where everyone's ideas are valued.


About You



We are looking for a student who is:



Fluent in written and verbal English
Currently enrolled in a relevant study program (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field).
Eager to learn about data engineering principles and practices.
Proactive, curious, and not afraid to ask questions.
Detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks.
Able to work independently and as part of a team.
Has basic programming skills (e.g., Python, PySpark) (advantageous, but not strictly required ‚Äì willingness to learn is key!).
Has a basic understanding of databases and SQL (advantageous).



About Us


Falck is a global leader in emergency and healthcare services. We are committed to preventing accidents, diseases, and emergency situations, and to providing rapid assistance when they occur. Join us and become part of a team that makes a real difference in people's lives.

The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Power Platform & AI Services, Strategic Automation and Master Data. In the entire function we are 80+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw.

Title: Student Analyst - Modelling, data analysis and supply chain management
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 96071

Time Type: Part Time

Do you want to be part of an international team focusing on creating better and greener supply chains for DSV‚Äôs largest customers?

As our Student Analyst, you can look forward to a myriad of challenges in modelling, data analysis and supply chain management. You will be exposed to a range of clients as well as a large part of the internal DSV organization. Through this job you will have the opportunity to develop your personal and professional competencies, and kick start your career within supply chain management.

Join an ambitious team of supply chain professionals

As part of the Supply Chain Optimisation team located at our headquarters in Hedehusene, Denmark, you will be working together with 13 likeminded colleagues locally, but you will be part of a larger global team. We are a diverse group of supply chain specialist with different backgrounds, but we all share a joint passion for supply chain management, so you will be sure to be challenged and develop professionally.

Help build better supply chains

In your role as Student Analyst, you will be working closely with the other analysts in the team. You will assist with analytical work on larger optimization projects for customers, but also run smaller projects independently as your competencies develop. The type of project varies and can include elements of e.g. network design and transport optimization. You will also run the monthly reporting for the department as well as support on ad hoc tasks. Your tasks include:



Independently run smaller data analysis projects
Contribute to larger data analysis tasks in relation to customer projects
Help create PowerPoint material to communicate complicated analysis results in a simple manner
Run monthly reporting



We expect you to work 15 hours a week, preferably as two full days in the office. We are flexible during the exam period, but also expect you to give an extra hand during busy periods.

An analytical talent with a passion for supply chain management

We imagine that you are in the final year of your bachelor‚Äôs degree or the beginning of your master‚Äôs degree and hold a great academic record. You study within the fields of supply chain management, transport and logistics, operations research, mathematical modelling or another relevant field where mathematical and analytical skills are a big component.

We are looking for a candidate with the following qualities:



You have great analytical skills
You know Excel and PowerPoint like the back of your hand
You have experience in doing data analysis in a scripted language, preferably python
You have excellent communication skills
You speak and write English fluently



Want to know more and apply?

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your opportunities in DSV. You are welcome to call Anton Fourie, Director, Supply Chain Optimisation on +45 25 41 65 00.

We look forward to receiving your application via the link below as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV ‚Äì Global transport and logistics

Working at DSV means playing in a different league.

As a global leader in transport and logistics, we have been on an extraordinary journey of growth. Let‚Äôs grow together as we continue to innovate, digitalise and build on our achievements.

With close to 160,000 colleagues in over 90 countries, we work every day to offer solid services and meet our customers‚Äô needs and help them achieve their goals. We know that the best way to achieve this is by bringing in new talent, fresh perspectives and ambitious individuals like you.

At DSV, performance is in our DNA. We don‚Äôt just work ‚Äì we aim to shape the future of logistics. This ambition fuels a dynamic environment built on collaboration with world-class team players, accountability and action. We value inclusivity, embrace different cultures and respect the dignity and rights of every individual. If you want to make an impact, be trusted by customers and grow your career in a forward-thinking company ‚Äì this is the place to be.

Start here. Go anywhere

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps l√∏sninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi s√∏ger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative datal√∏sninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudl√∏sninger p√• Azure med afs√¶t i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre B√∏rsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre √•r i tr√¶k. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi s√¶tter en √¶re i at levere software af den h√∏jeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle f√•r du?




Du kommer til at arbejde p√• et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam best√•ende af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus p√• √©t projekt og v√¶re tilknyttet √©t team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




r√•dgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsl√∏sninger i skyen
r√•dgive om og bygge l√∏sninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt ops√¶tning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overv√•gning og skalering af l√∏sninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videreg√•ende uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller m√•ske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere p√• - flere af f√∏lgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indg√• i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan √¶ndres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i h√∏js√¶det
Du er flydende i skrift og tale p√• dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at oms√¶tte kundebehov til handling

Som person er du selvst√¶ndig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at l√¶re nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du ogs√• er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at l√∏fte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?

Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens d√∏re altid er √•bne, og der er god plads til b√•de bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost p√• kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om √•ret afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i pr√¶cis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. Title: Manager, Global Insights NPS ‚Äì 6 Month Fixed Term Contract
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

We believe insights are more than data points ‚Äì they‚Äôre the spark behind ambitious ideas and smarter decisions.

At the LEGO Group, you‚Äôll help craft the future by turning shopper feedback into meaningful action through our NPS programs. If you're passionate about data, insights, and driving commercial impact, this is your chance to create a real difference ‚Äì even on a short-term contract.

This is a paternity cover position offered as a fixed-term contract from August 2025 through January 2026.

Please note Relocation support is not available for this role. We offer a flexible hybrid working model known as Best of Both, with 3 days in our Billund office and 2 days working from home.


Core Responsibilities





Manage and continuously evolve our global Shopper NPS programs
Lead the development and governance of the NPS data foundation, including data collection, validation, quality assurance, and access management
Collaborate with digital teams to integrate Shopper NPS data into LEGO Nexus
Design, maintain, and optimise Power BI dashboards and reports for the Shopper NPS programs
Deliver clear and impactful monthly partner reports on NPS insights and trends




Do you have what it takes?





Technical Skills Proficient in Databricks, SQL, Python, and other analytical tools; skilled in Power BI and PowerPoint
Analytical Attitude Able to turn complex data into clear insights and recommendations
Phenomenal Teammate! Collaborative and adaptable, growing in cross-functional global teams
Problem-Solver Confident using data to address business challenges and drive results
Some flexibility in working hours is expected in this global-facing role




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Om e-nettet

Hos e-nettet samler vi finanssektoren og digitaliserer Danmark. Vi udvikler unikke l√∏sninger, som leverer konkret v√¶rdi til kunder, borgere og samfund.

Description:
Mantell Associates is partnered with a cutting-edge MedTech organisation leveraging Robotics, AI, and Cloud technologies to digitise and optimise biotech workflows.




This innovative and fast-growing business is now looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join its high-impact team and play a key role in applying advanced analytics and machine learning to solve complex biological and operational challenges.




Data Scientist - Responsibilities:

Develop and deploy machine learning models to analyse complex datasets from biotech, medical, and laboratory workflows
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including software engineers, roboticists, and domain scientists to identify impactful data-driven opportunities
Work with structured and unstructured data to extract insights and support real-time and predictive analytics
Leverage cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for scalable model development and deployment
Build and maintain pipelines for data processing, feature engineering, and model monitoring
Contribute to experimental design, data quality improvement, and hypothesis testing across R&D and product teams
Present analytical findings and model outputs to stakeholders and guide decision-making through data




Data Scientist - Requirements:

3-6+ years of experience in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally within a Biotech, MedTech, or HealthTech environment
Hands-on experience working with Python and popular ML frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Proficiency in working with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for data science workflows
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, model development, and performance evaluation
Experience with biological, clinical, or laboratory data is highly preferred
Background in working within a start-up or scale-up organisation, with adaptability and a hands-on approach
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset




Mantell Associates is a specialist Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences headhunting firm. For more information on this opportunity, contact us at +44 (0)20 3854 7700.
