Title: Data Engineer-Aure
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer JD : years of experience in data & analytics in Azure or MSFT Fabric
Experience in developing data ingestion, data processing through Azure and analytical pipelines for relational databases, NoSQL and data warehouse solutions
Strong experience in data curation/aggregation/preparation using Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory and distilling data into meaningful insights with hands-on expertise on Azure and Databricks
Extensive hands-on experience implementing data migration and data processing using Azure services: ADLS, Azure Data Factory, Synapse/DW, Azure SQL DB, etc.
Excellent communication skills and able to demonstrate technical expertise with customer stakeholders
Solid experience leading data teams in developing data engineering platforms.
Good working knowledge of Azure Data Bricks, MSFT Fabric, Data Bricks Delta Lake, Azure Data Factory (ADF), ADF metadata driven pipelines, Azure DevOps, MS SQL Server, SSMS, Python and PySpark
Knowledge of Azure Synapse Analytics, Synapse Studio, Azure Functions, ADLS
SQL coding to write queries, stored procedures, views, functions etc. SQL management studio DB configuration experience.
Experience in SQL Server and SSIS packages ETL implementation experience knowledge of Azure SQL, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory (ADF), ADF metadata driven pipelines, Azure DevOps
Contribute to the delivery of data quality reviews including data cleansing where required to ensure integrity and quality.

Title: Analysestudent¬†
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Advice er et integreret bureau, der hj√¶lper ambiti√∏se virksomheder med at navigere og skabe resultater i en kompleks verden. Vi forbinder branding, marketing, agendasetting, stakeholder management og digital udvikling i l√∏sninger, der skaber v√¶rdi for kunder, forretning og samfund.

Vi er 130 specialister i K√∏benhavn og en del af teknologiselskabet Forte Digital, der har 300 medarbejdere i Berlin, Krakow og Oslo. Vi er drevet af lige dele indsigt, strategi og kreativitet og er forankret i et st√¶rkt samfundsansvar. Vi tror p√•, at de bedste l√∏sninger opst√•r, n√•r kreativitet, strategi og teknologi spiller t√¶t sammen.

Rollen som analysestudent

Vi s√∏ger en nysgerrig og engageret studentermedarbejder, der kan hj√¶lpe os med at indsamle og anvende data til at opn√• de skarpest mulige indsigter i vores kunders m√•lgrupper, interessenter, agendaer, indsatser og kampagner.

Du bliver en del af vores Agendas & Stakeholders-omr√•de og indg√•r som en integreret del af et fagligt milj√∏ med kolleger, der arbejder med public affairs, corporate communication og analyse. Vi baserer vores r√•dgivning p√• dyb indsigt i tidens‚ÄØmest toneangivende agendaer, sektorekspertise og evnen til at arbejde strategisk og operationelt med‚ÄØstakeholdere, positionering, omd√∏mme og interessevaretagelse.

Grundl√¶ggende tilbyder vi et helt unikt studiejob, hvor du f√•r hands-on erfaring med at gennemf√∏re analyseprojekter fra start til slut for b√•de offentlige og private kunder. Vi respekterer selvf√∏lgelig dine eksamener og studieforpligtelser. Du vil f√• ansvar i takt med dine kompetencer og tryghed ved opgaverne ‚Äì og vi st√∏tter dig hele vejen.

Dine opgaver vil typisk omfatte:


At gennemf√∏re analyser p√• baggrund af surveys ‚Äì herunder b√•de udvikling af sp√∏rgerammer, ops√¶tning af surveys og analyse af data
At gennemf√∏re analyser p√• vores kunders egne kommunikations- eller forretningsdata ‚Äì herunder datarens, statistisk modellering og visualisering
At indhente data fra forskellige eksterne datakilder ‚Äì f.eks. via Danmarks Statistik
At udarbejde og give inputs til pr√¶sentationer af analyseresultater overfor vores kunder


Din baggrund

Vi ser gerne, at du har f√¶rdiggjort din bacheloruddannelse, og at dine interesser ligger i sp√¶ndingsfeltet mellem samfund, kommunikation og teknologi. M√•ske l√¶ser du sociologi, statskundskab, antropologi eller lignende. Det vigtigste er, at du har skarpe kvantitative analytiske f√¶rdigheder og en st√¶rk interesse for, hvordan kommunikation p√•virker samfund og mennesker.

Vores analyseworkflow er bygget i R, s√• det er en stor fordel, hvis du har kendskab til eller hands-on erfaring med kodebaserede databehandlingsprogrammer s√•som R og/eller Python ‚Äì eller er i gang med at tilegne dig f√¶rdigheder inden for disse.

Kalder jobbet p√• dig?

S√• vil vi elske at h√∏re fra dig.‚ÄØ‚ÄØSend os en ans√∏gning med CV eller link til opdateret LinkedIn profil og udskrift af karakterer, s√• vender vi tilbage snart. Du er selvf√∏lgelig ogs√• velkommen til at r√¶kke ud direkte til:‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

Axel L√∏ppenthin, Senior Advisor

Title: Student Assistant in Pricing & Business Analytics
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do You Dream of a Career with Global Impact and Visibility in an Ambitious and Growing Company?

Join Our Pricing Strategy Team as a Student Assistant ‚Äì and Help Shape Smarter Decisions at Hempel!

Are you passionate about data, curious about pricing, and ready to turn your analytical skills into real business impact? Join Hempel‚Äôs Pricing Strategy team and be part of a global company that‚Äôs on a journey to double its impact ‚Äì sustainably.

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Student Assistant, you'll play a vital part in transforming data into actionable insights that drive smarter pricing decisions across Hempel. Your work will directly support our Double Impact strategy ‚Äì helping us grow while reducing our environmental footprint.

You‚Äôll support automation, digital tools, and scalable analytics that are changing how we approach pricing ‚Äì and you‚Äôll gain valuable experience in a dynamic, international environment.

Get ready to join a purpose-driven team with global reach. In this role, you will:


Dive into real-world pricing challenges with ad hoc business and performance analyses
Create and maintain Excel and Power BI tools for reporting that supports decision-making
Help build scalable pricing models and insightful dashboards
Turn complex data into compelling presentations and visual stories
Collaborate with passionate professionals across teams to ensure data accuracy and alignment


What We Are Looking For


You‚Äôre currently studying Business Analytics, Economics, Engineering, Data Science, or something similar
You know your way around Excel and are eager to grow your skills in Power BI
You may have dabbled in SQL, Python, or R ‚Äì or you‚Äôre curious to learn
You have a keen eye for detail, and you love solving problems
You‚Äôre collaborative, curious, and always ready to learn
Bonus points if you‚Äôre excited about AI, automation, or digital tools


What‚Äôs In It For You


Hands-on experience with real impact in a global business
Work with and learn from experts in pricing strategy and analytics
Flexible hours tailored to your studies ‚Äì and the chance to grow with us
Be part of a friendly and supportive team that‚Äôs not afraid to innovate


Global career possibilities

At Hempel, we offer a global career in a purpose-driven company that puts innovation, collaboration, and sustainability first. You‚Äôll join a new and ambitious team with the opportunity to shape the direction we take and leave a lasting impact.

Sounds like a match?

Welcome to apply! Click the ‚ÄòApply for position‚Äô button in the top-right corner and submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system. Final deadline for applications is 10 July 2025. For further information about the job, please contact Dennis Bonn√© ‚Äì debon@hempel.com

Chemicals

At Hempel, you‚Äôre welcomed to a global community of +7000 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We‚Äôre on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players.‚ÄØWhich is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return,‚ÄØyou will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company ‚Äì and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.‚ÄØ We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.

We‚Äôre on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players.‚ÄØWhich is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return,‚ÄØyou will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company ‚Äì and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.‚ÄØ We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.

Title: Manager, People Data Products
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data scientist with a passion for insights and analytics? Do you want to progress your career with the world‚Äôs largest jewellery brand, recently ranked number 1 employer in Denmark? ... If so, look no further. This could be the job for you!

We are looking for a talented People Data Product Manager to join our global HR Insights and Data team in Copenhagen.

This person will lead the design, development, and scaling of advanced analytics products, data platforms, and predictive models that enable workforce decisions with speed, clarity, and confidence. They will own the full lifecycle of scalable people data products and act as the bridge between data science, stakeholder needs, and enterprise enablement.

Key responsibilities will include:


Owning and managing the end-to-end delivery of people analytics products, from problem definition and scoping to design, deployment, and iteration
Developing and scaling self-service dashboards and custom visualizations that make complex data actionable for HR, Finance, and business leaders
Leading the development of predictive and prescriptive models to support attrition risk, engagement forecasting, talent acquisition effectiveness, and workforce planning
Applying machine learning and NLP techniques (e.g., segmentation, regression, sentiment analysis) to surface insights from structured and unstructured dataBuild and maintain automated data pipelines and a scalable analytics infrastructure, including model governance and reusable toolkits
Ensuring high standards of data privacy, compliance, and ethical AI practices, including bias mitigation and responsible model use
Staying current on emerging workforce analytics technologies and lead internal innovation through experimentation with new tools
Contributing to the evolution of the People Data Platform strategy in alignment with Pandora‚Äôs broader analytics and digital transformation goals



We are looking for a positive, self-driven individual who thrives in fast-paced environments and is determined to achieve outstanding results. We hope to see that you have the following experience.


5+ years proven experience in a data analytics, people analytics, or HR technology role‚Äîpreferably within a global or matrixed organization
Hands-on expertise with programming languages and tools:
Python or R for data manipulation and model building
SQL for data extraction and large-scale joins from HR and enterprise systems (SuccessFactors)
Proficiency in data visualization platforms (eg) Power BI, Tableau, etc..
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and NLP libraries
Demonstrated track record of building and deploying predictive/prescriptive models in business contexts‚Äîpreferably HR-focused (attrition, talent acquisition, engagement)
Working knowledge of data privacy, security, and compliance standards (GDPR, CCPA, or equivalent)



Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora‚Äôs future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com .

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational ‚Äì and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Student Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Developer

Join our team at Copenhagen Energy Trading




Do you want to be part of a fast-growing energy company with high ambitions, a tech-driven mindset, and plenty of room for personal and professional development? Are you passionate about green energy, software development, and analytics?




Then take a look at this exciting opportunity to develop your skills at Copenhagen Energy Trading ‚Äì a young and fast-growing energy trading company based in Copenhagen.




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

You‚Äôll join our Tech team, where we build tools that support every part of the trading process ‚Äì from data pipelines and forecasting models to trading dashboards and automated systems. Everything is built in Python, and we maintain a high standard for clean, well-structured code.




As a student developer, you‚Äôll:

Work on real production tools (not just side projects)
Improve your Python and analytics skills
Learn about power markets and how tech enables trading
Make a real impact from day one, with plenty of freedom and responsibility




You‚Äôll be part of an open and collaborative culture where honesty and transparency shape how we work and grow together. We believe in giving you autonomy, flexibility, and trust, and if things go well, this could lead to a full-time position after graduation.




What We Offer

A student position (15-20 hours per week) with flexible working hours to ensure that you can balance work and studies without compromise
Work alongside experienced and ambitious teammates who set a high bar for quality, and learn what professional software development looks like in the real world.
The opportunity to build your influence and leave your fingerprint on the way we work in a young and fast-growing company
A steep learning curve in a fast-moving, tech-first environment
Competitive pay, team events, and a super friendly vibe
A potential path to a full-time role after graduation




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Currently studying a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Passionate about software development with strong programming skills in Python. Experience with other programming languages, such as Go, Rust, or .NET is an advantage but not a requirement
Familiarity with Git and SQL
Interest in energy markets, trading, or solving complex technical problems
A proactive mindset and eagerness to learn from a fast-paced team
Fluent in English (written and spoken)
Bonus: Experience running software in production or building personal projects




Who We Are

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.




We specialise in short-term power trading across Europe and North America. Technology is at the heart of our operations, supported by a team of top-tier talent. Driven by data and technology, we use deep insights into electricity markets to create discretionary and algorithmic trading strategies that efficiently move power to where it‚Äôs needed most.




We believe in a culture of collaborative growth and do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.




Interested?

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading, we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. We interview candidates continuously and may select the right candidate prior to the expiry of the job ad. So please do not hesitate to apply.




Application Deadline: August 1, 2025

To apply, submit your cover letter, CV and relevant school diplomas. For more information, you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen (CTO) at jcj@copenhagen-energy.com or our Recruitment Manager, Anna Schumann, at as@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Quantitative Product Analyst ‚Äì Pricing Algorithms
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Why Join Us?

Join a pioneering team that‚Äôs reshaping the future of global Ocean logistics. At the intersection of technology, data, and strategic decision-making, you'll have direct impact‚Äîtransforming how we price, operate, and innovate at scale. Your analyses won't just influence products; they'll steer business-critical decisions, driving measurable commercial impact. Expect high visibility, rapid learning, and collaborative colleagues deeply committed to growth, experimentation, and responsible scaling. Be part of the journey where your insights fuel smarter, faster, and more confident global logistics decisions.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a structured, curious, and impact-driven Quantitative Product Analyst to join our Product team working on dynamic pricing in global Ocean logistics. You‚Äôll help us measure and improve the real-world performance of our pricing algorithms‚Äîfrom bookings and revenue to customer behaviour and internal trust.

This is a hands-on, high-exposure role ideal for someone early in their career with strong foundations in quantitative methods. We welcome candidates from diverse applied backgrounds‚Äîincluding marketing measurement (incremental ROAS, geo-lift, MMM), energy or volatility trading (e.g., power/commodity/financial option markets), and economic evaluation. If you enjoy bringing clarity to complexity, structuring ambiguous problems, and informing decision-making through data, this role is definitely for you.

What you'll be doing:


Partner with product managers and data scientists to define success metrics and develop robust evaluation frameworks for algorithmic pricing models.
Analyze production data to assess commercial impact across bookings, revenue, and customer behaviour.
Design and interpret experiments and quasi-experiments (e.g., A/B testing, synthetic control, difference-in-differences) to evaluate pricing and product changes.
Help develop dashboards, alerts, and performance tracking tools for algorithm monitoring.
Communicate findings clearly across technical and non-technical audiences to influence product and commercial decisions.
Work closely with pricing, commercial, and analytics teams to ensure performance metrics are aligned with strategic objectives.


To succeed in this role, we believe that you can offer:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, or Energy Systems)
3‚Äì7 years of experience in a data-intensive or modeling-heavy role (e.g., marketing analytics, trader, data analyst, pricing analyst, or economist)
Proficiency with Python and SQL; ability to manipulate and analyze large datasets
Familiarity with causal inference methods, experimental design, and time-series analysis
Strong analytical thinking, business acumen, and communication skills


Preferred Backgrounds:

We welcome a range of applied experience, some examples include:


Marketing measurement, such as media mix modelling (MMM), geo-experimentation, or incremental ROAS analysis
Energy or volatility trading, including demand forecasting and pricing under uncertainty
Quantitative economics, especially with experience in policy impact evaluation, structural modelling, or applied econometrics


If you are ready to take on this challenge and make a tangible difference, let's connect. We're excited to see what you‚Äôll bring to the team!

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Title: Graduate Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I am working with an exciting research consultancy looking for a Graduate Developer!




They are a forward-thinking company focused on revolutionizing the way biological data is analysed and shared, offering cutting-edge solutions to the research community. As they expand, they are looking for talented professionals to help build innovative software platforms that will drive scientific progress.










The Role




As the company continues to grow, they're looking to bring on a Graduate Developer to join their close-knit team of 10.




This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is due to graduate this summer and has a solid foundation any framework/language, whether through university projects, internships, or personal work. You'll work closely with backend developers to build and integrate new features and contribute to exciting client-driven projects from day one.




If you're passionate about development and eager to learn in a fast-paced, supportive environment, this is an amazing opportunity to start your career.




You will be working mostly on site in their Copenhagen office.




Benefits

Salary between 40K ‚Äì 55K DKK per month
25 Days holiday
Paid lunch at the company office







If this role could be for you drop me an email at gabby.bergonzi@amicusjobs.co.uk

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Group

Global Operations >>> Technology >>> Data & Insights

Reports To

Head of Data & Insights

LOCATION:

Hybrid/Remote - Denmark

Position Summary

Do you want to make a real impact ‚Äî not just write code, but build something that matters?

As a Data Engineer, you‚Äôll help fuel global transformation; your work will bring clarity to chaos, connecting scattered data into a single source of truth that powers our next generation planning platform, o9.

If you‚Äôre driven by purpose, hungry to grow, and excited to see your work make a visible difference, this is where you belong.

As a Data Engineer, you will build and improve data pipelines for the o9 planning tool, ensuring clean, governed, and ready-to-use data from various sources. You‚Äôll also contribute to broader platform development, supporting our data warehouse and other analytics initiatives.

You‚Äôll be part of a global company on a bold data-driven transformation ‚Äî shifting from gutfeel to insight, from silos to clarity. Your work will help shape how we plan, decide, and act at every level. This isn‚Äôt just about building pipelines; it‚Äôs about building trust in data, unlocking scale, and enabling smarter decisions across the business. You‚Äôll play a real part in turning data into a true driver of change ‚Äî and that change starts with you.

Key Responsibilities


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that deliver refined, high-quality data to our o9 planning platform
Consolidating and transforming data from multiple internal and external systems for planning and analytics use
Supporting and enhancing our data warehouse infrastructure , ensuring consistency and reliability of source data
Applying data validation rules , quality checks, and governance standards throughout the pipeline
Implementing and maintaining monitoring , alerting, and documentation to ensure system transparency and stability
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to continuously improve workflows, tools, and technical practices


Who We Are Looking For

A hands-on builder who thrives in a structured but evolving environment, that enjoys making things work ‚Äî not just once, but reliably, and at scale.

You take pride in delivering clean, maintainable pipelines and are comfortable following guidance, standards, and best practices set by more senior engineers.

You‚Äôre curious, eager to learn, and ready to grow your craft by working on real-world data challenges with business impact.

Key Skills & Experience


Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities


Supplementary Skills & Experience


Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures
Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data


OUR VALUES


A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that‚Äôs always improving
Flexibility in how and where you work ‚Äî remote, hybrid, or onsite
Show more

  • Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
  • Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
  • Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
  • Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
  • Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
  • A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
  • Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
  • Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
  • Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
  • Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities

Supplementary Skills & Experience

  • Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures
  • Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
  • Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
  • Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
  • Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data

OUR VALUES

  • A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
  • Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
  • A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
  • Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that‚Äôs always improving
  • Flexibility in how and where you work ‚Äî remote, hybrid, or onsite

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
As we‚Äôre continuing our journey towards becoming the best bite-sized audio platform in the world, we need more manpower within the Artificial Intelligence team. Our senior data scientists are producing high value algorithms which need to be put in production early in the development process in order to ensure fast product iterations and best quality results.

We are looking for an experienced data engineer to support the AI team with developing and putting their data products into production. More generally the machine learning engineer will help enforcing best practices, implement innovative solution architectures and build a lean data organization.

Your role will be bridging the AI team with both the data engineering team and the tech team. This implies the ability to both understand the requirements coming from machine learning based products and the current technical architecture of our products in order to ensure seamless and efficient integration.

You will help the teams bring ideas from conception to release while advocating for clean and understandable solutions along the whole journey. You are an effective diplomat with strong communication and organizational skills. You are patient, understanding, ego-free, and eager to give and receive constructive feedback.

Expected start date: Soon! - but we‚Äôre flexible.

You will be tasked with:


Managing a dedicated Kubernetes cluster
Implement CI/DC pipelines for data products
Define and implement complex data processing pipelines
Building micro-services for connecting internal and external services
Help integrate algorithm-generated data into our Elastic Search search engine


We expect you to bring:


Solid hands on experience with Kubernetes is a must
Knowledge of search principles and technologies. Knowledge of vector search
Good experience with Google Cloud Platform products incl. BigQuery, Kubernetes, Composer (Airflow), PubSub, etc.
Fluency in languages such as Python, Rust and C# or F#
Advanced Level in SQL
Experience in working within an agile, intensely iterative requirements and development process
Effective communication skills, with ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical resources and peers
Self-motivated and self-managing
Comfortable with a dynamic and fast-paced start-up environment
Experience in creating a performant infrastructure for data collection, storage, processing and exposure, preferably with Google Cloud
Solid experience with designing scalable and reliable data processes including handling with data pipelines and ETL processes


These are the benefits


Up to six months of fully paid parental leave (up to 6 months) for all new parents - no matter your gender and no matter where in the world you live.
Participation in our ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Program)
Learning and development opportunities to make sure you stay on top of the game
Flexible work. Opportunity to work flexible hours and remote
The chance to make an impact at an international company and see your work pay off immediately
Delicious free lunch with great colleagues


This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear ‚Äì whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We respect our coworkers‚Äô ideas, opinions, and time, approach our work with integrity and humility, and recognize the value everyone brings. We believe we are better together and have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We‚Äôre fiercely passionate about creating, finding, and hearing great stories. We care for our creators and the beautiful stories they share and we have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we love to have a good time doing it.

For more information or questions please contact us at benjamin@podimo.com or phone number 51913590

Title: Junior Analyst (Origination)
Description:
Blue Power Partners is a global consultancy and project development company dedicated to developing renewable energy. It supports leading developers, asset owners, and technology companies worldwide in the origination, development, construction, and performance optimization of onshore/offshore wind, solar, PtX and storage projects.

We are expanding our activities and currently looking for a passionate and analytical Student Assistant/Junior Analyst who would like to join an international and multicultural environment in downtown Aalborg or Copenhagen.

About The Role‚ÄØ

You will join our Origination team which delivers project origination and market, policy and regulatory advisory and project integration. Being a part of Origination entails coordination and collaboration across the entire organization, which means you will be working with an eclectic range of talented colleagues, from GIS specialists to finance, business case modelling, energy planners, power market specialists, route-to-market advisors, and engineers across multiple fields.‚ÄØ

We seek a highly motivated, creative and detail-oriented Junior Analyst to join our team. You will be involved in a variety of projects, and you get the opportunity to develop and challenge your competencies and knowledge in practice.

The Junior Analyst will be primarily responsible for conducting data analysis, GIS mapping, generating reports, and supporting various teams across the organization with originating new projects and delivering advisory to our clients.

Your accountabilities are likely to vary, but your main tasks will include:


GIS mapping and data manipulation
Support developing a project hypothesis around new project ideas and support driving the early-stage project Origination.
Prepare comprehensive reports and presentations summarizing key findings.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their needs and provide various forms of ad-hoc support.
Market research as part of identifying project opportunities in new markets.
Assist in collecting, understanding, and applying new GIS data sets to provide insight into renewable energy challenges and opportunities.


In this role, we expect you to work 10-15 hours on average per week, possibly adding more hours and with a minimum of one full day at the office (8-16). It is essential for us that you take care of your studies, which means we are flexible in exam periods and when facing project deadlines.

Being a global company, we also offer opportunities to travel abroad for internships in cases where it is relevant.

Our headquarters in Aalborg, John F. Kennedys Plads 43, or our Copenhagen office in Nordhavn at Troms√∏gade 2, will be your working place.‚ÄØ

About You

Being successful in this role depends on your ability to maneuver in an agile and entrepreneurial organization where every new day is different.

You are a team player, outgoing, and hold a ‚Äúcan-do-attitude‚Äù and you are eager to deliver best in class.

Preferably, we expect you to enrich our business with the following experience and skills:


GIS experience and capabilities to create maps and conduct simple data manipulation tasks like creating buffers, area size and distance calculations and other simple tasks.
A solid understanding of energy systems and dynamics between gas, electricity and heating systems.
A basic understanding of the following energy production and conversion technologies: Wind turbines, solar PV, gas/coal power plants, electrolyzers, storage options.‚ÄØ
Experience with energy system simulations and business case metrics such as: levelized cost of energy (LCoE), net present value (NPV) and discount rate.
A basic understanding of the complexities of developing and planning for new infrastructure projects: permitting & environmental, land zoning and municipal planning and stakeholder involvement.
Preferably, you are enrolled on a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in engineering or a planning field related (e.g., Urban, Energy and Environmental planning, land surveying, energy engineering or equivalent).


Why join Blue Power Partners?

At Blue Power Partners, we foster belonging, purpose, and different perspectives, ensuring everyone feels valued, empowered, and heard. This drives our innovation and collective success. We aim to create an entrepreneurial and sustainable working environment with a strong balance and healthy working habits to attract and retain the right people. Our recruitment is guided by our core values: Trust, Entrepreneurship and Balance, which are embedded in everything we do.

To achieve our vision and mission, we must continuously grow as individuals and as a company. We invest in our people to help them reach their full potential, believing that individual growth fuels company growth. Joining BPP means being part of a flat organization that prioritizes flexibility, agility, and well-being, providing a supportive community where you feel valued and trusted.

Application & Contact

For additional information about this position, please get in touch with Lasse Hvid Jensen, Head of Global Origination, at lhj@lbluepp.dk.

Your resume and application must be submitted in English via our recruitment system.

Start date: Flexible.
Show more

Title: Business Analyst to join the Nordic CEO Office
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team




At the Nordic CEO Office, we are a team of approximately 10 people, supporting the Nordic CEO and the Nordic Head of Transformation. Our area of responsibility covers both strategy, transformation, and the executive agenda, where we work closely with business leaders and teams within Deloitte.




We are a dedicated team of professionals who work closely together on projects, processes, and tasks. We value a culture based on trust, where we have fun in what are often busy days, and we help each other succeed. We expect everyone to contribute, and for this, our Business Analysts are a vital part of the team.




Job Description




Are you interested in working in the intersection of strategy and transformation? Do you want to make an impact while being part of an inclusive culture based on collaboration, curiosity, and high ambitions?




We offer an attractive part-time student position of approximately 15 hours per week, where you will have the opportunity to contribute, learn, and develop in a variety of tasks while gaining valuable experience from working at a leading global professional services firm.




Your place of work will be at our office in Copenhagen, and the position will offer flexibility around your studies and exams.




In this role, you will make an impact by:




Supporting the executive agenda, communication, and engagement around our Nordic strategy
Contributing to the preparation and follow-up on leadership and communication activities
Developing presentations and key material for our Nordic executive management teams
Performing quantitative and qualitative data analyses to ensure solid argumentation for recommendations
Assisting on cross-functional projects in collaboration with team members
Providing support in facilitating our Nordic annual cycle and strategy execution




Qualifications




You are a student currently enrolled at a relevant university with at least two years remaining in your studies. Your field of study is within economics, business administration, management, or a related field, and we expect you to have demonstrated your skills and have relevant experience from a previous or current role.




You are curious, proactive, with a positive can-do attitude, and you demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and develop through diverse tasks, including leadership communication, data analysis, and structured follow-up on activities and plans.




What you bring to the team:




An analytical mindset with the ability to think and solve tasks through a structured approach
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey insights and key messages from analyses effectively
Structured and detail-oriented, committed to delivering quality deliverables on time
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and thrive in a varied, fast-paced environment
Strong interest in business, business strategy, leadership engagement, and communication
Fluency in English, both oral and written
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite ‚Äì especially PowerPoint and Excel




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, and grade transcripts by 04.08.2025. We process applications continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible. Interviews will be held from the start of August.




Expected start date: 01.10.2025 or as soon as possible.




Please do not hesitate to contact Valerie Weihprachtitzky, Manager at +45 52 80 57 20, if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.




By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths ‚Äì because that is how we can make a difference.

Title: Analytics Engineer (9-month contract)
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you want to help us build a data-driven culture for digital product development? We have an amazing job opportunity for you!

We are looking for an Analytics Engineer in our Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team. Come and help us build a robust behavioral analytics platform for our portfolio of consumer-facing LEGO websites, apps, and other owned experiences.


Core Responsibilities

Partner with multiple digital product teams to define & implement our data model, ensuring we have a scalable way of turning raw data from a range of sources into structured tables and data feeds that are aligned with the most common business questions requiring analysis and reporting





Work with Analytics Business Partners in the team to play an active role bridging the gap between business needs, technical possibilities, and privacy compliance requirements ‚Äì Play a leading role to define the analytics infrastructure strategy for Digital Consumer Engagement.
Design and create a semantic & reporting layer for our suite of digital products, including the build and maintenance of DBT models for our behavioral analytics platform.
Partner with the LEGO Data Office to develop standards and ways of working for data producers and data consumers across Digital Consumer Engagement and embed these across digital product teams (data quality, data ownership, documentation, code standards, etc.).
Support and/or manage ad-hoc third party data ingestions to the LEGO Data Platforms required, such as App Store Data, Media Agency Reporting, etc.
Actively build and collaborate with a cross-functional data & analytics network to develop and embed standards for data modelling, data management, code standards, and documentation ‚Äì ensure that we are set up to scale as our digital capabilities grow.
Maintain a continual outside-in focus and drive our team‚Äôs understanding of the latest technologies and methods of managing and analyzing large data sets.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team is an analytics and continuous improvement practice within the LEGO Group‚Äôs Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) function. Our focus is on establishing two-way, long-lasting and meaningful relationships with our consumers and shoppers. We believe that the ethical, transparent, and effective use of consumer data is key to this ambition.

We are seeking a dedicated analytics enablement specialist to join our team and lead the set-up of our data platform and analytics reporting layer for a domain within the team. Partner closely with our Data Office and engineers across digital product teams, and work with analytics business partners to transform raw data into a reusable format that can be used for analysis & reporting. Join a team of likeminded people who collectively are shaping how we approach analytics on our LEGO owned apps and websites!

Do you have what it takes?

Formal training in software development, product management, agile, or digital analytics and at least 2-3 years‚Äô experience in a similar role





Deep, hands-on mastery of SQL, and ideally one of Python and/or R ‚Äì This role is a technical profile and requires someone with a deep passion for analyzing large structured and unstructured data sets.
Hands on experience with the set up and maintenance of bronze, silver, and gold layers in a big data platform, ideally Databricks and Apache Spark. And experience building and maintaining DBT models.
A desire and passion for transforming raw data into structured tables which can answer common business questions.
Proven experience working with behavioral data across web & app platforms.
Comfort with ambiguity, and a natural preference for an environment where you play an active role in defining the solution to complex and undefined problems ‚Äì We‚Äôre looking for a lynchpin who isn‚Äôt afraid to get things done even when they don‚Äôt have formal authority over everyone who needs to be involved to make it work, and is able to build collaborative working relationships across organizational boundaries.
Build trusted working relationships with both technical and non-technical colleagues and partners, and a demonstrated ability to simplify complex topics to those less familiar with data infrastructure.




This is a 9-month temporary position based in either Billund, Denmark or London, UK. Relocation support is not available for this role.

Nice to Have





Experience with applied statistics across multiple data sources
Passion for advanced data science & machine learning methodologies
Experience ingesting owned and 3rd party data sources into a central data platform, and building/maintaining data pipelines including working with and building APIs
Experience working with global teams across multiple geographies and cultures is an asset




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Core Responsibilities

Partner with multiple digital product teams to define & implement our data model, ensuring we have a scalable way of turning raw data from a range of sources into structured tables and data feeds that are aligned with the most common business questions requiring analysis and reporting



  • Work with Analytics Business Partners in the team to play an active role bridging the gap between business needs, technical possibilities, and privacy compliance requirements ‚Äì Play a leading role to define the analytics infrastructure strategy for Digital Consumer Engagement.
  • Design and create a semantic & reporting layer for our suite of digital products, including the build and maintenance of DBT models for our behavioral analytics platform.
  • Partner with the LEGO Data Office to develop standards and ways of working for data producers and data consumers across Digital Consumer Engagement and embed these across digital product teams (data quality, data ownership, documentation, code standards, etc.).
  • Support and/or manage ad-hoc third party data ingestions to the LEGO Data Platforms required, such as App Store Data, Media Agency Reporting, etc.
  • Actively build and collaborate with a cross-functional data & analytics network to develop and embed standards for data modelling, data management, code standards, and documentation ‚Äì ensure that we are set up to scale as our digital capabilities grow.
  • Maintain a continual outside-in focus and drive our team‚Äôs understanding of the latest technologies and methods of managing and analyzing large data sets.



Play your part in our team succeeding

The Data, Analytics & Business Improvement team is an analytics and continuous improvement practice within the LEGO Group‚Äôs Digital Consumer Engagement (DCE) function. Our focus is on establishing two-way, long-lasting and meaningful relationships with our consumers and shoppers. We believe that the ethical, transparent, and effective use of consumer data is key to this ambition.

We are seeking a dedicated analytics enablement specialist to join our team and lead the set-up of our data platform and analytics reporting layer for a domain within the team. Partner closely with our Data Office and engineers across digital product teams, and work with analytics business partners to transform raw data into a reusable format that can be used for analysis & reporting. Join a team of likeminded people who collectively are shaping how we approach analytics on our LEGO owned apps and websites!

Do you have what it takes?

Formal training in software development, product management, agile, or digital analytics and at least 2-3 years‚Äô experience in a similar role



  • Deep, hands-on mastery of SQL, and ideally one of Python and/or R ‚Äì This role is a technical profile and requires someone with a deep passion for analyzing large structured and unstructured data sets.
  • Hands on experience with the set up and maintenance of bronze, silver, and gold layers in a big data platform, ideally Databricks and Apache Spark. And experience building and maintaining DBT models.
  • A desire and passion for transforming raw data into structured tables which can answer common business questions.
  • Proven experience working with behavioral data across web & app platforms.
  • Comfort with ambiguity, and a natural preference for an environment where you play an active role in defining the solution to complex and undefined problems ‚Äì We‚Äôre looking for a lynchpin who isn‚Äôt afraid to get things done even when they don‚Äôt have formal authority over everyone who needs to be involved to make it work, and is able to build collaborative working relationships across organizational boundaries.
  • Build trusted working relationships with both technical and non-technical colleagues and partners, and a demonstrated ability to simplify complex topics to those less familiar with data infrastructure.



This is a 9-month temporary position based in either Billund, Denmark or London, UK. Relocation support is not available for this role.

Nice to Have



  • Experience with applied statistics across multiple data sources
  • Passion for advanced data science & machine learning methodologies
  • Experience ingesting owned and 3rd party data sources into a central data platform, and building/maintaining data pipelines including working with and building APIs
  • Experience working with global teams across multiple geographies and cultures is an asset



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Secomea:‚ÄØSecomea is a leader in Operational Technology (OT) secure remote access (SRA) for industrial control and critical infrastructure. We are at the forefront of one of the most exciting business opportunities today, characterized by a dynamic ecosystem of Machine Builders, System Integrators, and OT customers. As cyber security and compliance become top priorities, we are committed to protecting the factory floor.

Join us at an exciting time of growth as we scale our industrial B2B SaaS platform. We‚Äôre looking for a passionate Data Engineer who thrives on building scalable, high-impact data systems that power real business outcomes.

In this role, you‚Äôll shape and maintain modern data pipelines using Databricks and Microsoft Azure, while optimizing our Lakehouse architecture for performance, efficiency, and cost.

You'll collaborate with talented teams across Product, Engineering, and Analytics to ensure that clean, reliable data fuels everything from day-to-day operations to strategic AI initiatives.

You‚Äôll play a key role in automating business processes, enabling self-service analytics, and supporting the deployment of machine learning models. If you're excited to make a tangible impact in a data-driven company that‚Äôs growing fast, this is your opportunity.

What You‚Äôll Do


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT workflows using Databricks
Optimize and maintain our Lakehouse architecture for performance and cost-efficiency in Microsoft Azure and Databricks
Collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, and Analytics teams to ensure reliable and timely data availability
Build out data models that support self-service analytics and reporting
Implement best practices for data governance, quality, and security
Participate in code reviews, architecture decisions, and continuous improvement initiatives
Identify and implement improvements to data reliability, efficiency, and quality across our pipelines and data architecture
Automate key data-driven business processes to improve operational efficiency and support the organization‚Äôs ability to scale
Support our AI and machine learning initiatives by ensuring access to high-quality, well-structured data and helping deploy models into production environments


Tech Stack


Cloud: Microsoft Azure (Data Lake Storage)
Processing & Modeling: Databricks (PySpark, Delta Lake)
Visualization: Microsoft Power BI
Orchestration: Databricks Workflows
Languages: Python, SQL
Version Control & CI/CD: GitHub


Requirements


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure and Databricks
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience designing and building large-scale, distributed data processing systems
Familiarity with data warehousing and dimensional modeling
Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to Have


Knowledge of CI/CD and DevOps practices for data
Experience in B2B SaaS or working with product-led growth organizations
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker, Tableau)
Show more

Title: Student Data Scientist (ML)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a student interested in data and ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges? At Danske Bank, we‚Äôre looking for a Student Assistant in Data Science to join our Customer Intelligence team ‚Äî where we use data and machine learning to better understand and serve our customers.

You‚Äôll support projects that shape how we personalize experiences, predict customer needs, and drive smarter marketing and service decisions.

üíº What You‚Äôll Do

As part of a skilled and supportive team, you‚Äôll assist with a range of tasks that support the development and deployment of machine learning models for retail banking use cases:


Help prepare and explore customer data (transactional, behavioral, demographic)
Support ongoing work on churn prediction, propensity modelling, segmentation, and CLV estimation
Run exploratory analyses and assist with feature engineering and data validation
Contribute to internal documentation, data quality checks, and model evaluation
Learn about model governance, responsible AI, and data-driven decision-making in banking
Work closely with experienced data scientists in an environment focused on learning and collaboration


üìö What We‚Äôre Looking For


You‚Äôre currently enrolled in a relevant degree (e.g., Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics with a quantitative focus)
You have a strong interest in machine learning, customer behavior, and applied data analytics
You‚Äôre comfortable with Python and familiar with tools like pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn
You‚Äôre proactive, analytical, and curious ‚Äî with a willingness to learn and contribute
You can commit to working 15‚Äì20 hours per week alongside your studies


üí° Nice To Have (But Not Required)


Experience working with real-world datasets in a project or internship
Familiarity with SQL, cloud platforms (e.g., Azure), or MLOps tools
Interest in retail banking, financial services, or digital marketing analytics


üåü What We Offer


A hands-on opportunity to work with real customer data in a leading bank
A friendly and collaborative team culture that values learning and development
Flexible working hours tailored to your academic schedule
The chance to see how AI and data science are used in a highly regulated, customer-focused industry
Working in our new HQ with great facilities


üì© Interested?

Please apply for the position by submitting your CV and cover letter through our careers page or LinkedIn ! Let‚Äôs build the future of AI together!

First interviews will start up end of June, so don‚Äôt hold back!

#st

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Student Assistant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Could Your Career Matter Twice?

Join the Hempel Hull Performance Solutions team! Hempel is a leading coating manufacturer that delivers solutions to clients which affect their operation and the environment. One of our key solutions is marine coatings that save fuel for our clients and reduce CO2 emissions. It is a strategic priority for Hempel to use data to provide the best possible advice to our customers related to hull and propeller maintenance and to constantly improve our understanding on the impact that our solutions have for our clients. This is where you come in.

You have the chance to become part of Hempel‚Äôs Marine Data and Technology department, which provide digital solutions to our customers and colleagues within the marine business segment.

How will you contribute?

As a Student Assistant in the hull performance team at Hempel, you will assist our in house development team in developing our digital solutions related to hull and propeller performance monitoring. You will conduct data analysis on pilot project level and assist in writing small pieces of code for our production environment. In addition, you will write scripts for extracting and preprocessing data from automatic emails and/or APIs and run statistics on our large data sets. You will be a part of an international team and work in a true global organisation where we collaborate with our regional teams to exceed client needs and expectations.

What will your day-to-day look like?


Extracting and automating data collection from emails, APIs or web portals
Support development of new analysis tools and methods in order to constantly improve accuracy and usefulness of vessel performance analysis results together with department.
Run statistics on performance data in order to increase knowledge and optimize customer advice


What does it take to become a Hull Performance Analyst at Hempel?


A technical background with 1.5-3 years of studies remaining
Good data analytical and mathematical skills
Good coding/programming skills (Matlab, R, Python or similar)
A self-motivated, upbeat and proactive mindset
A good sense of order
A detail oriented approach
Good English skills (corporate language).
Good interpersonal skills and desire to work with cross functional teams with diversified backgrounds.


Does this sound like you?

To apply for this position, please submit your application letter with a CV in English via our recruitment system by clicking the link ‚ÄòApply‚Äô at the top of this post.

Please note: due to holiday and vacation schedules, we will not start processing applications until the first week of August. Candidates will only be contacted if they are being considered for the role.

The final deadline for applying is July 15th, 2025

If you have any questions about the job or application process, please contact Manager, Hull Performance and Analytics, Ditte Gundermann on DIGU@hempel.com or +45 45273788

The job is located at Hempel‚Äôs headquarters in Lyngby, Denmark

Application due

2025-07-15

Seniority Level

Job Functions

Industry

Chemicals

At Hempel, you‚Äôre welcomed to a global community of +7000 colleagues around the world. A workplace built on shared trust, mutual respect and support for each other.

We‚Äôre on a mission to double our impact. To succeed, we need bright minds and team players.‚ÄØWhich is why, from day one, your input, ideas and initiative are not only welcomed, but expected. In return,‚ÄØyou will enjoy great opportunities for development in a growing global company ‚Äì and be part of the solution by contributing to our global impact.

At Hempel, we are committed to everyone feeling safe, valued and treated equally, in an environment where each employee can bring their authentic selves to work.‚ÄØ We believe that inclusion is key to innovation and by bringing together the most diverse perspectives and talents, we can achieve great things, together.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Platform team

Are you passionate about building solid data foundations? At Better Collective, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Engineer to help us take our data platform to the next level. In this role, you‚Äôll be a key contributor to the development and maintenance of our core data infrastructure, making sure data flows smoothly, securely, and reliably across the company.

While the role is focused on paid media, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with other domains as well ‚Äî and if you're excited about working with modern technologies and contributing to a growing, cross-functional data platform, you‚Äôll feel right at home here.

Innovation is a big part of our culture, so if you're excited about working with modern technologies and shaping the future of our data platform, you‚Äôll feel right at home here.

Key Responsibilities


Build and maintain robust data pipelines that move and transform data from different sources.
Help manage our cloud data infrastructure to ensure it‚Äôs secure, scalable, and efficient.
Collaborate with data analysts and business teams to ensure data is accessible and reliable.
Contribute to best practices for version control, testing, and monitoring of data systems.
Stay current with new tools and technologies, and bring fresh ideas to the table.
Work with other engineers and learn from experienced colleagues.



Our expectations to you


Solid experience with cloud data tools (e.g. Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, or similar).
Strong SQL skills and experience writing Python for data transformation and automation.
Familiarity with tools like dbt, Dagster, Airflow, or similar for data modeling and orchestration.
Understanding of scalable system design and data performance considerations.
A structured and hands-on approach to problem-solving and development.
Interest in working with modern data infrastructure in a collaborative environment.
Experience with machine learning pipelines is a bonus, but not required.



Not sure you meet every single requirement? That‚Äôs okay‚Äîyour unique experience might be exactly what we‚Äôre looking for.

Your colleagues say you


Break down complex problems into manageable parts
Are dependable and take initiative
Are practical and thoughtful when solving technical challenges
Are a team player who enjoys building and improving systems together



What Do We Offer You

Joining Better Collective, you will become part of a dream team of talented individuals that play each other well. Our workplace is a powerade of caring supportive colleagues who unite over ambitions, curiosity, passion, and our desire to have fun together. With our four company values Integrity, Respect, Ambition and Collaboration we thrive to be a company that is inclusive and a safe place for our employees, with room to be innovative and courageous.


Flexible working hours which supports a healthy work-life balance
Private health insurance
A varied everyday life in a fast-paced international business
A lot of great office perks such as lunch, snacks, gym, social events etc.
A professional yet casual working climate with very skilled, passionate and fun colleagues you can imagine
Ability to work remotely



Your way to BC

Please note that we are processing applications on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. If you want to know more about the job, feel free to contact:

Frederik Hagelund, Head of Data Platform at fhagelund@bettercollective.com.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Digital Insights Senior Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

PPO Digitalization & Excellence (D&E) in Operations

Our team is part of a larger organization responsible for Planning and Portfolio Optimization (PPO) on behalf of Novonesis Operations. PPO D&E is responsible for driving excellence in global planning processes (S&OP) and supportive systems (SAP IBP and APO). On behalf of PPO, we own the digitalization roadmap and deliver a wide range of critical business insights tools to enable Novonesis‚Äôs strategic goals and needs.

We are an international team of highly skilled planning and production experts, committed to shaping the future of planning and production execution in Novonesis. We support each other through close collaboration, knowledge sharing, and a strong team spirit that helps us navigate both everyday tasks and complex challenges.

Our Responsibilities Include


Driving digitalization initiatives and delivering business insights tools
Managing planning systems and processes (SAP IBP, APO)
Supporting strategic decision-making through data and analytics


We are expanding into new areas such as AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics. We are piloting tools like Microsoft Copilot and SAP Joule to enhance our semantic models and data products.

Join Us in Shaping the Digital Future of PPO

We are looking for a Digital Developer to join our newly established Digitalization & Analytics team within the Planning and Portfolio Optimization (PPO) department. This is a unique opportunity to make a real impact by helping shape the digital foundation of a growing team and enabling data-driven decision-making across the organization.

In this role, you will lead the development and governance of digital tools and insights that support PPO‚Äôs strategic goals. You will act as a project manager and digital enabler‚Äîcoordinating with technical teams, engaging stakeholders, and ensuring the delivery of scalable, high-quality analytics solutions. You will also play a key role in driving our AI journey, leading pilot projects and implementing AI tools on top of our semantic models and data products.

What You‚Äôll Do


Lead the design and implementation of scalable, user-friendly dashboards by coordinating with technical experts and ensuring alignment with design principles
Collaborate closely with stakeholders across PPO to understand business needs and ensure the delivery of actionable, high-quality insights that support strategic and operational decision-making
Lead the team‚Äôs AI journey by initiating and managing pilot projects and deploying AI tools that enhance our semantic models and data products (Copilot, SAP Joule and others)
Manage the lifecycle of analytics and insights to support strategic decision-making across PPO
Ensure digital governance of key tools and data products, maintaining data integrity and insight quality
Promote digital tools and foster a culture of data curiosity and co-development within the PPO community


What You Bring


Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders
Proven ability to support complex processes and deliver value through digital solutions
Solid understanding of business, production, or supply chain processes
Project management experience, particularly in cross-functional and digital transformation initiatives
A proactive, hands-on mindset with a strong sense of urgency and accountability
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Fluency in English, both written and spoken


Preferred Qualifications


MSc. in Business Engineering, Mathematics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field
Experience in data and systems analysis, including Business Intelligence, planning, and ERP systems
Familiarity with AI/ML tools and their application in business contexts
Understanding of semantic data models and modern data architecture
Proficiency in tools such as Power BI, KNIME, and Snowflake
Experience working in agile environments and a passion for continuous improvement


Work model: Hybrid (3 days on-site, 2 days remote)

Work schedule: Standard full-time schedule

Travel requirements: Up to 10 working days per year

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

PPO Digitalization & Excellence (D&E) in Operations

Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) og CI/CD-principper
Python, SQL og distribuerede systemer
Integrationer med eksterne datakilder og eksponering via APIs
Et hold af dygtige kolleger, som gerne deler viden, sparrer og hj√¶lper

Du er m√•ske specialist i Azure, AWS eller GCP ‚Äì og du er ikke bange for at arbejde med forskellige hyperscalere
Du er nysgerrig, l√∏sningsorienteret og har lyst til at udvikle dig
Du kan kommunikere klart og konstruktivt ‚Äì b√•de med kolleger og kunder
