Title: Sustainability & operations analyst (m/f/d) (internship) - July 2025
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Responsibly üåçüå±




Responsibly is a sustainability tech start-up with the vision of making every purchase in the world responsible.




We're founded by two serial entrepreneurs with previous successes such as Dixa and Ofload, and have received pre-seed funding from some of Europe‚Äôs top VCs and angels. We're now building a top-tier team to tackle this big thing called climate, and have fun while we're doing it ü§ò.




Let‚Äôs change the world together üéØ




There‚Äôs no bigger problem out there than the changing climate, and procurement represents a big part of the solution - when purchase decisions are made on the background of responsible data, such as CO2 footprint, suppliers have a huge incentive to change.




However, procurement is becoming overloaded with complexity and struggle getting data in the first place. Different frameworks, different data sources, different coverage, and an overloaded supplier making it difficult to make purchase decisions to improve the sustainability of your supply chain.




At Responsibly, we're solving this issue by using ai to power your sustainability due dilligence and automatically understand how sustainable every supplier is.


Tasks


What you‚Äôll be doing üôå

We're looking for an intern to join our ESG operations team. That means you'll get deep experience with ESG data, ai and automation. You'll be:





Analyzing supplier sustainability data collected through our automation engines and flagged for review


Working on our ai and automation agenda to ensure every supplier can run through a fully automated due dilligence journey - that means diving deep on ai technologies and operational processes.


Quality assuring the data in the Responsibly platform to ensure we're representing the sustainability profile of the supplier as best as possible.


Supporting our Data Operations team with day-to-day tasks and long-term strategic milestones





You may also be supporting our ESG expertise team, which could include:





Interpret various social & environmental impact certificates and assessment scores according to our proprietary scoring methodology


Identify new sources for responsible sourcing data by assessing various supplier websites



Requirements


About you üòé





You have some practical experience through an internship/business study activity in analytical environments, where you‚Äôve had to navigate and make sense of complex problems


You want to build a career in sustainability and ai


You are a strong problem solver with excellent structure, and love analyzing data


You take a high degree of ownership in your work and are ready to attack unfamiliar problems with enthusiasm and a bias for action!


It's a bonus if you have a good understanding of the sustainability space and are familiar with different sustainability frameworks and initiatives.


It's a bonus if you have some basic knowledge and understanding of SQL and databases


You thrive in a fast-moving environment and love being through into the deep-end


You're passionate about your work and ambitious


English is our working language, hence excellent skills are a must



Benefits


Your benefits ü§©





Awesome office and culture with amazing lunch right on Island's Brygge


We love to build an awesome culture and community in our office, but we also offer flexibility when you need it.


Lots of fun, such as our annual company events or Friday bars





Still need to be convinced? ü§î





It‚Äôs the opportunity to join an early-stage tech & social impact startup on an incredible journey. You‚Äôll have the independence and space to release your creativity.


You'll become a vital member of the team, and your efforts will have a direct impact on Responsibly‚Äôs success.


You‚Äôll be part of a dynamic company with enthusiastic and highly talented teammates from various backgrounds and countries ‚Äì always ready to share knowledge, support, and a beer! Successes are always shared together


We have fun and we make an impact - life is about more than work!





The internship is full-time (40 hrs/week), paid, and ideally for 6 months. The location is Copenhagen, and a European work permit is required.




PLEASE NOTE: Starting period is ideally July 2025.




Please clarify in your application the following points:





For how many months are you available for an internship?


When is your earliest starting date?





We encourage you to apply even if you don't fulfill all requirements, as we're looking for driven and passionate individuals who are willing to learn and grow. We look forward to reading your application! ü§ì

Show more

Title: Real World Evidence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The department Real World & Analytics Solutions in the Nordics is a multidisciplinary consulting team serving life science and healthcare stakeholders with insights and advice. In Real World Solutions we aim to serve Nordic pharma companies and other stakeholders with Nordic treatment insights based on real world data and Real World Evidence studies. We actively collaborate with hospitals, regional payers and national registries on research and policy related topics.

As an Analyst focusing on Real World Solutions you will work on interesting projects for Nordic clients. Analysts are responsible for supporting and delivering project work with guidance from senior colleagues, and be willing to learn and develop professionally and personally. Your analytical, inter-personal and project management skills will be called upon from day one.

Every project will be different but an idea of the things that you are expected to accomplish are the following:



Assist in conducting thorough qualitative and quantitative research (for both scientific and non-scientific focused projects)
Write and/or review data access applications to Nordic health data authorities (e.g. patient-level data, aggregate data requests)
Under supervision manage patient level data according to standard procedures
Under supervision apply statistical analysis to collected primary and secondary data
Reach out and liaise with potential sites (e.g. hospitals, data holders) and stakeholders such as KOLs, Payers, Clients etc; for set up of contracts, project meetings, confidentiality agreements and applications
May perform CRA Site Management visits
Conduct interviews with local stakeholders as well as patients
Create well-structured, client-facing deliverables and communicate insights
Stay up to date on the national health data access landscape in your country
Contribute to proposal development
With support, serve as project manager on small client engagements
Engagement based responsibilities are assigned and closely managed by Consultants, Senior Consultants, Engagement Managers or Principals.


About You


Candidates interested in joining as a RWS Analyst should have:
PhD in Life-Science or other relevant scientific subject with experience in life science
MSc (or equivalent) combined with 1-3 years of working experience in life science
Experienced and comfortable with statistical analysis in R and/or SAS or similar statistical software
Understanding processes of local healthcare system, their interaction, and the impact of external/internal influences on decision making
Excellent communication skills in English and Danish, living in Copenhagen
Good and comfortable at structuring information in a logical way
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with others across the Nordic countries and with global excellence centers
Adaptability and an ability to learn quickly and apply new knowledge


Nice To Have


Previous experience with Nordic registry data and submitting data access applications
Working experience with Real-World Data in the Nordics (or equivalent experience)
High digital affinity and MS Office (Word, PPT, Excel) skills are an advantage


Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com
Show more

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Student Worker within BI for Ops PMO
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Could you see yourself take part in delivering digital solutions that enable leaders see how projects perform and support the strategy? You will get a fantastic opportunity to help visualize how management brings strategy to life.

Buckle up and get yourself energized for a student worker journey, full of development opportunities within portfolio management. Bring out your sharpest analytical instruments, find your inner data driven spirit, pack-up your best communication skills and get your playful groove on to take the role as student worker within portfolio management.


Core Responsibilities





Product development in Power BI (Project Reports)
Product maintaince and improvement
Support & training
Process development and facilitation




Do you have what it takes?

It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.

Further





You are student at a Bachelor level in an IT, Engineering or business related field or equivalent working experience.
Are advanced in Excel.
Knowledge of Power BI, PowerApps and Power Automate.
Good understanding of SharePoint.
Solid process development skills enabled by strong structure and organization skills.
Ability to communicate complex/detailed information in a simple and visual way ‚Äì fluent English.
Customer driven and service minded.
Knowledge on portfolio management and portfolio analysis/reporting.
Person must thrive juggling multiple tasks in a dynamic environment with many stakeholders, have a good sense of humor and an accommodating personality.
Ability to combine and reuse knowledge into new ideas.
Ability to take initiative and act on opportunities.
Can speak and write English at an advanced level.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO¬Æ team today.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With over 100,000 employees across 130 countries A.P. Moller - Maersk is a global leader in logistics services and can offer you the opportunity to grow and evolve in a truly diverse workplace. A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated container logistics company working to connect and simplify its customers‚Äô supply chains. With simple end-to-end offering of products and digital services, seamless customer engagement and a superior end-to-end delivery network, Maersk enables its customers to trade and grow by transporting goods anywhere - all over the world.

About the role:

Maersk is incorporating machine learning and mathematical optimization into our core operations to elevate decision-making processes. We are actively searching for a skilled Analytics Engineer to join our team and contribute to the expansion of our advanced analytics capabilities. In this position, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, develop impactful solutions, and implement algorithms focused on improving operational efficiency and decision-making. You will collaborate with peers, mathematical optimization experts, business specialists, and software developers to pioneer and develop our ambition to transform how we design one of the world‚Äôs largest container shipping network.

What We offer:

To work at Maersk is to work with the world. You‚Äôll learn from ‚Äì and collaborate with ‚Äì skilled professionals who literally move the world, every day. With a supportive environment to develop your skills, you‚Äôll gain access to world-class learning programmes to accelerate your career goals. And you‚Äôll find yourself welcome in our diverse and inclusive culture, where you are valued for who you are and rewarded for what you bring. For this and many other of our roles, we can offer the flexibility of hybrid working, alongside industry leading benefits such as pension and family health/dental insurances as standard.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

As an Analytics Engineer within the Network Strategy team, your primary responsibility will be to develop advanced decision-support tools in close collaboration with Maersk‚Äôs business stakeholders. These tools will play a critical role in shaping the design of our global network and ocean products.

You will be at the forefront of building and deploying optimization algorithms that enhance operational efficiency and enable data-driven decision-making across our shipping network. Your work will directly influence how we plan, adapt, and optimize our services in a dynamic global environment. Working alongside subject matter experts, you‚Äôll identify opportunities to create additional value by evolving our analytical tools and models to better support strategic and tactical decisions. Reporting to the Lead Analytics Engineer of the network strategy team, you will play a key role in shaping the vision for leveraging software to optimize Maersk's business operations.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you can offer:

A strong technical background, holding a top of class master's or PhD degree in engineering, mathematics, or computer science, with a focus on artificial intelligence/machine learning and/or mathematical optimization/operations research.

You ideally have a minimum of 2 years of professional experience in software development, specifically in the domain of algorithms and optimization tools. You excel at translating business requirements into mathematical and quantitative models and adhere to best software development practices.

You have an analytical mindset and thrive in solving intricate technical challenges. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are required to enable seamless collaboration within teams and with external stakeholders. Proficiency in both written and oral English is essential for this role.

You possess significant expertise in the following areas:


Applying advanced analytics and/or AI to address real-world challenges.
Software development, particularly in C++ and Python.


Plus experience with one or more of the following fields


Graph theory and its applications.
Statistical and probability analysis.
Combinatorial optimisation
Metaheuristics


If you are ready to take on this challenge and make a tangible difference, let's connect. We're excited to see what you‚Äôll bring to the team!

Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineer Trainee
Place: K√∏benhavn SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a motivated student with a passion for data and a desire to learn the ropes of data engineering?

We are looking for a curious and proactive Student Assistant to join our team and embark on a journey into the world of data engineering. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience, learn from experienced professionals, and contribute to meaningful data projects within a dynamic international company. You'll also be supported every step of the way with a dedicated, experienced engineer mentor to guide you on this exciting journey.


About The Job



What you will learn and do:




Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines.
Learn about data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Work with various data tools and technologies used in a professional environment.
Collaborate with data engineers and data scientists on exciting projects.
Gain practical experience in a real-world data engineering setting.
Develop your skills in cloud platforms.


You will be stepping into an international team located in Copenhagen & Warsaw. This position is based in Copenhagen, Denmark

At Falck, we prioritize creating a positive work culture. Our team enjoys regular team-building activities, social events. The student position is 20 hours per week, with the possibility of flexibility to make room for study and work.

Join us and be part of a team that's shaping the future of data in healthcare in a collaborative work environment where everyone's ideas are valued.


About You



We are looking for a student who is:



Fluent in written and verbal English
Currently enrolled in a relevant study program (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field).
Eager to learn about data engineering principles and practices.
Proactive, curious, and not afraid to ask questions.
Detail-oriented and has a structured approach to tasks.
Able to work independently and as part of a team.
Has basic programming skills (e.g., Python, PySpark) (advantageous, but not strictly required ‚Äì willingness to learn is key!).
Has a basic understanding of databases and SQL (advantageous).



About Us


Falck is a global leader in emergency and healthcare services. We are committed to preventing accidents, diseases, and emergency situations, and to providing rapid assistance when they occur. Join us and become part of a team that makes a real difference in people's lives.

The Data function is where data is turned into information in Falck. We are four different teams working with: Data & Analytics, Power Platform & AI Services, Strategic Automation and Master Data. In the entire function we are 80+ data specialists working in Copenhagen and Warsaw.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bank of London

Bank of London offers a safer business banking model by holding all deposits at the Bank of England, eliminating the risk of 'bank runs.' It provides services such as Deposit-as-a-Service (DaaS), Embedded Banking, real-timeClearing, Payments, and Settlement, as well as Commercial Banking tailored to businesses. Powered by proprietary technology, the bank collaborates with SAP Fioneer to deliver innovative solutions. With a focus on exceptional service and core values of compassion, ownership, and curiosity, the bank strives for excellence in all it does.

Requirements

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to oversee our organisation's data reporting, analysis, and visualisation efforts. The ideal candidate will possess advanced Power BI expertise with a track record of automation within a regulated environment.

This role is pivotal in driving data-driven decision-making across the business by ensuring the delivery of insightful, accurate, and timely management information.

You will be applying your advanced analytical skills, across complex data, commercial and product scenarios, guiding strategy, planning and operational activities. Your responsibility for delivery of management information, will be invaluable for equipping our teams with game changing insights.

You will play a critical role in design and production of Management Information (MI). You will engage and collaborate with colleagues, communicating your researched insights in order to drive individuals, teams and projects in their actions.

Lead the MI function, ensuring data integrity, accuracy and timeliness of reports
Drive the automation agenda, removing manual processes and building scalable MI solutions as a foundation for growth
Respond to ad-hoc data requests from colleagues
Prioritisation of regular and ad hoc reporting to satisfy external and internal stakeholders
Maintain the integrity of the MI Process with detailed review and data cleansing to ensure all data and reports are accurate, current, complete and consistent
Continuously review and improve MI processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy and relevance of reporting

Responsibilities

You will have an eye for detail which is second to none and be keen to keep learning in a tech savvy environment. You will be able to communicate the relevance and importance of your data insights, guiding colleagues towards achieving exceptional outcomes.

Data Visualisation: Expertise in creating interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI. (Essential)
SQL Proficiency: Strong ability to write and optimise SQL queries for data extraction and analysis. (Essential)
Data Warehousing: Experience with Snowflake for data storage and management. (Preferred)
Data Analysis: Advanced analytical skills to interpret data and provide actionable insights
DirectQuery & ETL: Experience working with DirectQuery mode and designing efficient ETL processes. (Preferred)
Stakeholder Engagement: Ability to translate technical concepts into insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Proven track record of prioritising and managing department objectives.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver a high level of accuracy in the role
Have the ability to organise and prioritise workloads to ensure business critical work is completed
At least two years experience working with Power BI
A good team player who can also work from own initiative especially with data

Location

London or Belfast (5 or 4 days per week in the office).

Travel to other locations may be required on occasion.

Diversity

Bank of London is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion, diversity and belonging. All qualified applicants are welcome and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion or religious expression, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity and expression, transgender, national origin, or military veteran status.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

At Colliers, we empower individuals to shape the future of real estate. As a leading global real estate services and investment management company, we deliver expert advice to occupiers, owners, and investors across all property sectors. From advisory and brokerage services to valuation, project management, research and more - our professionals work collaboratively to deliver impactful results.

With our UK headquarters in London and 1,200+ experts based across 16 offices in the UK and Ireland, we pride ourselves on a culture of innovation, collaboration, and long-term career development.

Job Description

An immediate opportunity has arisen for a London-based property data analyst in Colliers UK Research & Economics Research Team at our Wigmore Street headquarters. The role will include assisting in the collection, processing and reporting of standard property market metrics across all sectors but will also be central to our in-house development and roll-out of an innovative data analytics platform. Assisting with our quarterly forecasting processes and overseeing our internal GIS offer are also part of the role (in-house training will be provided). The Data Analyst will work directly under the supervision of our Deputy Head of Department. The role will also have great visibility and will involve liaising with our IT and Marketing Departments.

Qualifications

The successful candidate will range from recent graduates to individuals with some related experience. In all instances, the successful candidate is likely to possess a working knowledge of Microsoft Office and familiarity with basic descriptive statistics. Some knowledge of inferential statistics (correlations, r2, etc) would be an advantage as is previous experience in research in real estate or related disciplines. Communication skills are important as the position requires considerable cross-disciplinary interpersonal contact. A degree in any related discipline is anticipated but any coursework related to economics, statistics, information technology or the like will be an advantage. The job is not an IT job, but if you can demonstrate experience or a personal working knowledge of API feeds this would set you apart as our databases are increasingly API fed. GIS experience is not essential but would help along with familiarity with Alteryx. Training will be offered.

What is on offer.

The successful candidate will receive compensation and benefits in line with experience. The on-the-job training will also provide career enhancing transferable skills. Above all, Colliers is a collaborative and collegiate workplace with a strong sense of community. The management structure is not overly hierarchical meaning that all employees have ready access to the full range of Colliers experience.

Additional Information

At Colliers, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment process. In line with the Equality Act 2010, we will accommodate any suitable candidate requiring assistance to attend or conduct an interview. If you need any adjustments or support, please let us know when either scheduling your interview or in your application cover letter. We are dedicated to ensuring that everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed and are here to support you throughout the process.
Show more

Above all, Colliers is a collaborative and collegiate workplace with a strong sense of community. The management structure is not overly hierarchical meaning that all employees have ready access to the full range of Colliers experience.

Additional Information

At Colliers, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruitment process. In line with the Equality Act 2010, we will accommodate any suitable candidate requiring assistance to attend or conduct an interview. If you need any adjustments or support, please let us know when either scheduling your interview or in your application cover letter. We are dedicated to ensuring that everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed and are here to support you throughout the process.

Title: Data Analyst (Tableau)
Description:
About

I'm partnered with a PLC who are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team initially on a 12-month contract with potential to be made permanent.

This role will report to the Group Data Analytics Manager and will be responsible for delivering data workflows, visualisations and generating business insights. This will provide a foundation on which the business can make quicker, more informed business decisions. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders to aid in decision making and be a trusted, respected & knowledgeable point of contact between the Group Data Analytics team and the business.

Responsibilities

Analyse large and complex datasets and present these insights clearly to end users, for enhanced decision making. Working closely with business stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and requirements, including explaining complex principles to stakeholders of varying technical backgrounds. Sharing knowledge, collaborating and supporting other team members to assist them with their projects and development. Supporting business super users with their technical queries including delivering training and knowledge sharing. Design, develop, and maintain interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Tableau, sticking to the group's style guide where appropriate, whilst always looking for ways to enhance analysis and functionality where possible. Ensure dashboards are user-friendly, automated and provide actionable insights for stakeholders. Ensure all dashboards follow a strict peer review, QA and UAT process. Utilize Alteryx to create ETL pipelines, ensuring data accuracy and completeness throughout the process. Ensure all workflows follow a strict peer review, QA and UAT process. Utilise data services, whether that be dashboards, ETL pipelines, or curated data sources to generate new business insights. Business partner with divisional stakeholders to present these insights and advise on how these can enhance decision making. Link these insights to tangible actions that can aid the business in increasing revenue and reducing cost Skillset required:

Data visualisation experience with Tableau or similar product. Proficient in creating dashboards using multiple datasources and layouts. Excellent communication skills, including being able to adapt your communication style to suit the required audience. Also having the ability to influence others around you in the team. Strong attention to detail with exceptional analytical skills, including the ability to interpret complex business processes. Knowledge of SQL, Python, R or similar programming languages is advantageousIf this role is of interest, please apply directly with an updated CV

Nice-to-have skills


Tableau
ETL
SQL
Python
R
Harrogate, England


Work experience


Data Analyst


Languages


English
